en: Down from the top floor to the next one, where Mother and Father’s room was, and the large bathroom, and where he wasn’t supposed to be in any case.

en: The house in Berlin had stood on a quiet street and alongside it were a handful of other big houses like his own, and it was always nice to look at them because they were almost the same as his house but not quite, and other boys lived in them who he played with (if they were friends) or steered clear of (if they were trouble). The new house, however, stood all on its own in an empty, desolate place and there were no other houses anywhere to be seen, which meant there would be no other families around and no other boys to play with, neither friends nor trouble.
vi: Ngôi nhà ở Berlin nằm trên một con phố yên tĩnh, dọc con phố đó là một loạt ngôi nhà lớn như nhà cậu, và lần nào ngắm chúng cậu cũng cảm thấy tuyệt vì chúng hầu như tương đồng nhưng lại không hoàn toàn giống nhà cậu, và vì có những cậu bé khác sống trong đó, những đứa cậu chơi cùng (nếu tụi nó là bạn bè) hoặc tránh xa (nếu tụi nó hay gây rắc rối cho cậu). Còn ngôi nhà mới cứ đứng trơ vơ một mình trên khu đất trống trải, tách biệt và tứ phía chẳng hề thấy một ngôi nhà nào khác, có nghĩa là chẳng có gia đình nào sống xung quanh và không có cậu bé nào để chơi cùng, dù cho là bạn bè hay tụi chuyên bắt nạt.
tr: Berlin’deki ev sessiz bir sokaktaydı ve aynı sırada birkaç tane daha, kendi evleri gibi büyük evler vardı. Onlara bakmak keyifliydi; çünkü tam olmasa da, neredeyse kendi evleri gibiydi. O evlerde, eğer arkadaşsalar beraber oynadığı, eğer belalıysalar uzak durduğu başka çocuklar yaşıyordu. Yeni ev, bomboş bir alanın ortasında tek başına duruyordu. Etrafta görünen başka ev yoktu. es_translation: Mother smiled and carefully placed the glasses on the table. —I’m going to teach you another saying —he said—: "When the going gets tough, the tough get going."

en: He walked slowly towards it, hoping that from here he might be able to see all the way back to Berlin and his house and the streets around it and the tables where the people sat and drank their frothy drinks and told each other hilarious stories. He walked slowly because he didn’t want to be disappointed. But it was just a small boy’s room and there was only so far he could walk before he arrived at the window. He put his face to the glass and saw what was out there, and this time when his eyes opened wide and his mouth made the shape of an O, his hands stayed by his sides because something made him feel very cold and unsafe.
vi: Cậu từ từ đi về phía nó, hy vọng rằng từ đây cậu có thể phóng tầm mắt về tận Berlin, ngôi nhà của cậu, những con phố xung quanh đó, những chiếc bàn nơi mọi người ngồi uống loại nước có bọt và kể cho nhau nghe bao nhiêu chuyện cười. Cậu bước đi rất chậm bởi vì cậu không muốn phải thất vọng. Nhưng đó chỉ là căn phòng nhỏ dành cho một cậu bé nên cậu chỉ bước một quãng tí xíu là đã tới chỗ cửa sổ. Cậu áp mặt lên tấm kính rồi nhìn xem có gì ở bên ngoài, nhưng lần này vào lúc mắt cậu mở to và miệng cậu há thành hình chữ O thì hai bàn tay cậu vẫn ở nguyên hai bên bởi vì có một cái gì đó khiến cậu cảm thấy rất lạnh lẽo và thiếu an toàn.
tr: Yavaşça pencereye doğru yürüdü; oradan Berlin’i, evini ve evinin etrafındaki sokakları, masalarda oturan, köpüklü içkilerini içerken komik hikâyeler anlatan insanları görebilmeyi umuyordu. Yavaşça ilerledi; çünkü hayal kırıklığına uğramak istemiyordu. Fakat burası yalnızca küçük bir çocuk odasıydı ve pencereye ulaşması pek uzun sürmedi. Yüzünü cama dayadı ve dışarıda olanları gördü. Bu defa gözleri fal taşı gibi açılıp ağzı O şeklini alınca, kolları uzamadan, yanında kaldı. Çünkü bir şey onun, soğuk bir ürperti ve güvensizlik hissetmesine neden olmuştu.
es: Se acercó poco a poco, con la esperanza de divisar Berlín y su casa y las calles aledañas y las mesas donde los vecinos se sentaban a tomar sus bebidas espumosas y contarse historias graciosísimas. Avanzó despacio porque no quería llevarse un chasco. Pero como aquél era el dormitorio de un niño, no tuvo que caminar demasiado para llegar a la ventana. Pegó la cara al cristal y vio lo que había fuera, y esta vez, si bien sus ojos se abrieron desmesuradamente y sus labios formaron una O, sus manos permanecieron pegadas a los costados porque algo le hizo sentir un frío y un temor muy intensos.
vi_translation: You slowly walked towards it, hoping that from here you could gaze all the way to Berlin, your home, the surrounding streets, the tables where people sat drinking fizzy drinks and sharing countless jokes. You walked very slowly because you didn't want to be disappointed. But it was just a small room meant for a boy, so you only took a few steps to reach the window. You pressed your face against the glass and looked outside, but this time as your eyes widened and your mouth formed an O, your hands remained at your sides because something made you feel very cold and unsafe.
tr_translation: He walked slowly towards the window; he hoped to see Berlin, his home, and the streets around his house, the people sitting at tables, telling funny stories while drinking their frothy drinks. He proceeded slowly; because he did not want to be disappointed. But this was just a small child's room, and it didn't take long for him to reach the window. He pressed his face against the glass and saw what was outside. This time, when his eyes opened wide and his mouth formed an O shape, his arms did not extend but stayed by his side. Because something had caused him to feel a cold shiver and insecurity.
es_translation: He approached little by little, hoping to catch sight of Berlin and his house and the surrounding streets and the tables where the neighbors sat to drink their frothy beverages and tell each other very funny stories. He advanced slowly because he didn't want to be disappointed. But since that was a child's bedroom, he didn't have to walk too far to reach the window. He pressed his face against the glass and saw what was outside, and this time, although his eyes opened wide and his lips formed an O, his hands remained glued to his sides because something made him feel a very intense cold and fear.

en: ‘What are you doing in here?’ she shouted, spinning round. ‘Don’t you know you don’t enter a lady’s room without knocking?’
vi: “Em đang làm gì ở đây vậy,” cô hét lên, xoay người lại. “Em không biết là không được vào phòng con gái mà không gõ cửa à
tr: “Burada ne işin var?” diye bağırdı kız, dönerek. “Bir hanımın odasına kapıyı vurmadan girilmeyeceğini bilmiyor musun?
es: —¿Qué haces aquí? —le gritó ella, volviéndose rápidamente—. ¿No sabes que no se entra en la habitación de una dama sin llamar a la puerta?
vi_translation: “What are you doing here,” she shouted, turning around. “Don’t you know you’re not supposed to enter a girl’s room without knocking?”
tr_translation: “What are you doing here?” the girl shouted, turning around. “Don't you know that you shouldn't enter a lady's room without knocking?”
es_translation: —What are you doing here? —she shouted at him, turning around quickly—. Don't you know that you don't enter a lady's room without knocking on the door?

en: ‘Of course I did,’ she replied. ‘You don’t think I’d have left them at home? Why, it could be weeks before we’re back there again.’
vi: “Tất nhiên là chị mang hết theo rồi,” cô trả lời. “Chẳng lẽ phải em nghĩ chị để chúng ở nhà hay sao? Thôi nào,có thể phải vài tuần nữa chúng ta mới quay trở lại đó được.
tr: “Elbette getirdim!” diye karşılık verdi Gretel. “Onları evde bırakacağımı mı sanıyordun? Neden bırakayım? Oraya dönmemiz haftalar sürebilir.
es: —Pues claro. ¿Qué querías que hiciera, dejarlas en casa? Podrían pasar semanas antes de que volvamos allí.
vi_translation: “Of course I brought everything with me,” she replied. “Did you really think I would leave them at home? Come on, it might be a few weeks before we can go back there.”
tr_translation: “Of course I brought them!” replied Gretel. “Did you think I would leave them at home? Why would I leave them? It could take us weeks to get back there.”
es_translation: —Of course. What did you want me to do, leave them at home? It could be weeks before we go back there.

en: He continued to stroll and whistle and he continued not to look until he reached the window, which, by a stroke of luck, was also low enough for him to be able to see out of. He looked outside and saw the car they had arrived in, as well as three or four others belonging to the soldiers who worked for Father, some of whom were standing around smoking cigarettes and laughing about something while looking nervously up at the house. Beyond that was the driveway and further along a forest which seemed ripe for exploration.
vi: Cậu tiếp tục vừa bước đi vừa huýt sáo và tiếp tục không nhìn Gretel cho đến khi cậu tới gần cửa sổ, may sao nó cũng khá thấp nên cậu có thể nhìn được ra ngoài. Cậu nhìn ra thì thấy chiếc xe đã chở cả nhà tới đây, và ba bốn chiếc khác nữa của những người lính làm việc cho cha cậu, vài người trong số đó đang đứng xung quanh hút thuốc rồi cười rộ lên vì chuyện gì đấy trong khi vẫn căng thẳng ngước nhìn ngôi nhà. Phía bên ngoài là đường xe chạy, xa hơn nữa là một dải rừng có vẻ như đang sẵn sàng chờ khám phá.
tr: İlerlemeye, ıslık çalmaya ve ablasına bakmamaya devam etti. Ta ki pencereye varana kadar... Üstelik şansına, pencere dışarıyı rahatça görebileceği kadar alçaktı. Dışarı baktı, geldikleri arabayı ve babasının askerlerine ait üç dört araba daha gördü. Bazı askerler ayakta durmuş sigara içerken bir şeylere gülüyor ve gergin bir şekilde eve bakıyorlardı. İleride otoyol ve onun da ötesinde araştırılmaya hazır bir orman vardı.
es: El siguió andando y silbando, sin mirarla, hasta que llegó a la ventana. Por suerte, era lo bastante baja para poder mirar por ella. Se asomó y vio el coche en que habían llegado, así como tres o cuatro coches más de los soldados de Padre, algunos de los cuales andaban por allí, fumando cigarrillos y riendo de algo mientras miraban con nerviosismo hacia el edificio. Un poco más allá estaba el camino de la casa, y más allá había un bosque que parecía ideal para explorar.
vi_translation: He continued to walk while whistling and still did not look at Gretel until he reached the window, which fortunately was quite low so he could see outside. He looked out and saw the car that had brought the whole family here, along with three or four others belonging to the soldiers working for his father, some of whom were standing around smoking and laughing about something while still nervously glancing at the house. Outside was the driveway, and further away was a strip of forest that seemed ready to be explored.
tr_translation: He continued to walk, whistle, and avoid looking at his sister. Until he reached the window... Moreover, luckily for him, the window was low enough to see outside comfortably. He looked outside and saw the car they came in and three or four more cars belonging to his father's soldiers. Some soldiers were standing, smoking cigarettes, laughing at something, and looking at the house nervously. Further ahead, there was a highway and beyond that, a forest ready to be explored.
es_translation: He kept walking and whistling, without looking at her, until he reached the window. Luckily, it was low enough to be able to look through it. He leaned out and saw the car they had arrived in, as well as three or four more cars belonging to Father's soldiers, some of whom were walking around, smoking cigarettes and laughing at something while nervously glancing towards the building. A little further away was the house's driveway, and beyond that was a forest that seemed ideal for exploring.

en: ‘Well?’ he said, turning round now and seeing his sister standing in the doorway, clutching the doll, her golden pigtails perfectly balanced on each shoulder, ripe for the pulling. ‘Don’t you want to see them?’
vi: “Nào?” cậu nói, lúc này đã quay người lại và nhìn thấy chị gái vẫn đang đứng ở ngưỡng cửa, giữ chặt con búp bê, hai bím tóc vàng óng buông xuống hai bên vai cô cân bằng một cách hoàn hảo, sẵn sàng chờ cậu giật. “Chị không muốn nhìn thấy bọn nó à?”
tr: “Evet?” dedi dönüp kapıda duran ablasına bakarak. Gretel, bebeğine sarılmış, iki örgü halindeki altın sarısı saçları omuzlarında, gitmeye hazırdı. “Onları görmek istemiyor musun?
es: —¿Qué? —dijo el niño al volverse y verla plantada en el umbral, estrechando su muñeca, con las rubias trenzas en perfecto equilibrio sobre los hombros, a punto para recibir un buen tirón—. ¿No quieres verlos?
vi_translation: "Well?" he said, now having turned around and seeing his sister still standing at the doorway, clutching the doll tightly, her golden braids hanging perfectly balanced on either side of her shoulders, ready for him to pull. "Don't you want to see them?"
tr_translation: “Yes?” she said, turning to look at her sister standing at the door. Gretel, holding her doll, her golden blonde hair in two braids on her shoulders, was ready to go. "Don't you want to see them?"
es_translation: —What? —said the boy as he turned around and saw her standing in the doorway, clutching her doll, with her blonde braids perfectly balanced on her shoulders, ready to receive a good tug—. —Don't you want to see them?—

en: ‘Of course I do,’ she replied and walked hesitantly towards him. ‘Step out of the way then,’ she said, elbowing him aside.
vi: “Dĩ nhiên là có rồi,” cô trả lời và ngập ngừng bước về phía cậu. “Đứng tránh ra đi chứ, ” cô nói, huých Bruno snag một bên.
tr: “Elbette isliyorum,” diye cevap verdi Gretel ve ona doğru kararsızca yürüdü. “Çekil yolumdan o zaman.” dedi, onu dirseğiyle uzaklaştırırken.
es: —Claro que sí —replicó ella, y avanzó con paso vacilante—. Quítate de en medio —dijo, propinándole un codazo.
vi_translation: “Of course there is,” she replied and hesitantly walked towards him. “Move aside, will you,” she said, nudging Bruno to one side.
tr_translation: “Of course I want to,” Gretel replied, and walked towards him hesitantly. “Then get out of my way,” he said, pushing her away with his elbow.
es_translation: —Of course —she replied, and advanced with unsteady steps—. Get out of the way —she said, giving him an elbow.

en: To begin with, they weren’t children at all. Not all of them, at least. There were small boys and big boys, fathers and grandfathers. Perhaps a few uncles too. And some of those people who live on their own on everybody’s road but don’t seem to have any relatives at all. They were everyone.
vi: Trước hết, họ hoàn toàn không phải trẻ con. Không phải tất cả bọn họ, ít nhất là vậy. Có cả các cậu bé lẫn những cậu thanh niên, những người cha và những người ông. Có khi còn có một vài người chú nữa. Và một số người trong đó sống một mình giữa mọi người khác mà dường như chẳng có người thân thích nào cả. Đó là tất cả bọn họ.
tr: Onlar çocuk değildi. En azından hepsi değildi. Küçük çocuklar, büyük çocuklar, babalar ve dedeler. Belki birkaç tane de amca. Herkesten uzak duran, hiç akrabası yokmuş gibi olanlar. Herhangi birileri...
es: Para empezar, no eran niños. Al menos no todos. Había niños pequeños y niños mayores, pero también padres y abuelos. Quizá también algunos tíos. Y unas cuantas personas de las que viven en las calles y que parecen no tener familia.
vi_translation: First of all, they are not children at all. Not all of them, at least. There are both boys and young men, fathers and grandfathers. Sometimes there are even a few uncles. And some of them live alone among everyone else, seemingly without any relatives at all. That is all of them.
tr_translation: They were not children. At least not all of them. Little children, big children, fathers, and grandfathers. Maybe a few uncles too. Those who kept away from everyone, as if they had no relatives. Just anyone...
es_translation: To begin with, they were not children. At least not all of them. There were young children and older children, but also parents and grandparents. Maybe some uncles too. And a few people who live on the streets and seem to have no family. —Who are they?

en: It started off nicely enough. There was a garden directly beneath Bruno’s window. Quite a large one too, and full of flowers which grew in neat orderly sections in soil that looked as if it was tended very carefully by someone who knew that growing flowers in a place like this was something good that they could do, like putting a tiny candle of light in the corner of a huge castle on a misty moor on a dark winter’s night.
vi: Ban đầu khung cảnh đó cũng rất thú vị. Có một khu vườn ngay dưới cửa sổ phòng Bruno. Cũng khá rộng rãi, đầy các loài hoa trồng trên những luống đất ngay ngắn như thể đã được ai đó chăm sóc hết sức cẩn thận, một người biết rằng trồng hoa ở một nơi như thế này có nghĩa là họ đã làm được một điều tốt đẹp, giống như đặt một cây nên nhỏ xíu vào góc một tòa lâu đài đường bệ trên đồi hoang mù tịt giữa đêm đông tăm tối.
tr: Önce güzel başlıyordu: Bruno’nun penceresinin tam altında bir bahçe vardı. Oldukça genişti ve çiçek doluydu. Düzgün bir şekilde, sıra sıra dizilmişlerdi; sanki çiçek yetiştirmeyi bilen biri taralından düzenlenmişti. İyi bir şey yapmaya çalışmışlardı; karanlık bir kış gecesinde, puslu, büyük bir arazideki, dev bir şatonun köşesine küçük bir mum ışığı koymuşlar gibi. Çiçekleri geçince çok hoş, taş döşeli bir alan vardı.
es: A primera vista no estaba tan mal. Justo debajo de la ventana de Bruno había un jardín bastante grande y lleno de flores en pulcros y ordenados arriates. Parecían muy bien cuidados por alguien que hubiera comprendido que plantar flores en un sitio como aquél era una buena idea, como lo habría sido, durante una oscura noche de invierno, encender una velita en el rincón de un lúgubre castillo situado en medio de un brumoso páramo.
vi_translation: At first, that scene was also very interesting. There was a garden right below Bruno's room window. It was quite spacious, full of various flowers planted in neat beds as if someone had taken great care of them, someone who knew that planting flowers in a place like this meant they had done something beautiful, like placing a tiny candle in the corner of a grand castle on a desolate hill in the dark winter night.
tr_translation: It started beautifully: there was a garden right under Bruno's window. It was quite spacious and full of flowers. They were neatly arranged in rows, as if organized by someone who knew how to grow flowers. They had tried to do something good; like placing a small candlelight in the corner of a giant castle on a dark winter night, in a misty, vast land. After passing the flowers, there was a very pleasant, stone-paved area.
es_translation: At first glance, it wasn't so bad. Right below Bruno's window, there was a fairly large garden filled with flowers in neat and orderly flowerbeds. They seemed very well cared for by someone who had understood that planting flowers in a place like that was a good idea, just as it would have been, on a dark winter night, to light a small candle in the corner of a gloomy castle situated in the middle of a misty moor.

en: There wasn’t any grass after the fence; in fact there was no greenery anywhere to be seen in the distance. Instead the ground was made of a sand-like substance, and as far as she could make out there was nothing but low huts and large square buildings dotted around and one or two smoke stacks in the distance. She opened her mouth to say something, but when she did she realized that she couldn’t find any words to express her surprise, and so she did the only sensible thing she could think of and closed it again.
vi: Phía bên kia hàng rào không có lấy một cọng cỏ; thực tế thì nhìn từ khoảng cách này không trông thấy chút màu xanh nào. Thay vào đó mặt đất trông như được làm bằng một thứ chất liệu giống như cát, và theo những gì mắt cô nhận được ra thì ở đó chẳng có gì hơn ngoài những gian trại thấp lè tè cùng mấy tòa nhà lớn vuông vức rải rác xung quanh và xa xa là một hai cột khói. Cô định nói điều gì đó, nhưng khi vừa mở miệng cô đã nhận ra rằng cô không tìm ra từ nào để diễn tả được nỗi kinh ngạc của mình, vậy nên cô làm việc đúng dắn duy nhất mà cô có thể nghĩ ra ấy là khép miệng lại.
tr: Tel örgünün ötesinde çim yoktu; aslında gözle görülebilen uzaklara kadar hiçbir yeşillik yoktu. Bunun yerine zemin, kuma benzer bir maddeden oluşuyordu. Tek görebildiği, uzaktaki alçak barakalar ve kare binalarla araya serpiştirilmiş gibi duran birkaç duman kümesiydi. Bir şey söylemek için ağzını açtı, ama yaşadığı şaşkınlığı ifade edecek bir sözcük olmadığını fark etti; sonra aklına gelen tek mantıklı şeyi yaptı ve ağzını tekrar kapadı.
es: Detrás de la alambrada no crecía hierba; de hecho, a lo lejos no se veía ningún tipo de vegetación. El suelo parecía de arena, y Gretel sólo vio pequeñas cabañas y grandes edificios cuadrados, separados entre ellos, y una o dos columnas de humo a lo lejos. Abrió la boca para decir algo, pero no encontró palabras para expresar su sorpresa, así que hizo lo único sensato que se le ocurrió: volver a cerrarla.
vi_translation: On the other side of the fence, there wasn't a single blade of grass; in fact, from this distance, no green could be seen at all. Instead, the ground looked like it was made of a material similar to sand, and from what her eyes could make out, there was nothing more than low barracks and a few large square buildings scattered around, with one or two smoke stacks in the distance. She intended to say something, but as soon as she opened her mouth, she realized she couldn't find the words to express her amazement, so she did the only sensible thing she could think of and closed her mouth again.
tr_translation: There was no grass beyond the wire fence; in fact, there was no greenery as far as the eye could see. Instead, the ground was made of a substance similar to sand. All he could see were a few clusters of smoke that seemed to be scattered among the low barracks and square buildings in the distance. He opened his mouth to say something, but realized there was no word to express his astonishment; then he did the only logical thing that came to mind and closed his mouth again.
es_translation: Behind the barbed wire, no grass grew; in fact, in the distance, no type of vegetation could be seen. The ground seemed sandy, and Gretel only saw small huts and large square buildings, separated from each other, and one or two columns of smoke in the distance. She opened her mouth to say something, but couldn't find the words to express her surprise, so she did the only sensible thing she could think of: she closed it again.

en: ‘Yes, it’s the only explanation, don’t you see? When we’re at home, in Berlin, we’re in the city. That’s why there are so many people and so many houses and the schools are full and you can’t make your way through the centre of town on a Saturday afternoon without getting pushed from pillar to post.’
vi: “Phải, đó là cách lý giải duy nhất, em không thấy à? Khi chúng ta ở nhà mình ở Berlin, chúng ta ở thành phố. Đó là lý do vì sao có nhiều người, rất nhiều nhà cửa, còn trường học thì đông vui và em sẽ không thể đi qua trung tâm thành phố vào buổi chiều thứ 7 mà không bị xô đẩy từ bên này qua bên khác.
tr: “Evet, tek açıklama bu, anlamıyor musun? Berlin’de olduğumuzda şehirdeyiz. Bu yüzden çok insan ve çok ev var, bu yüzden okullar dolu ve bir cumartesi akşamüstü şehir merkezinde itilip kakılmadan yürüyemiyorsun.
es: —Sí, es la única explicación, ¿no te das cuenta? Cuando estamos en casa, en Berlín, estamos en la ciudad. Por eso hay tanta gente y tantas casas, y tantas escuelas llenas de niños, y no puedes caminar por el centro de la ciudad un sábado por la tarde sin que la multitud te empuje.
vi_translation: “Yes, that's the only explanation, don't you see? When we are at our home in Berlin, we are in the city. That's why there are many people, lots of houses, and the schools are bustling, and you can't walk through the city center on a Saturday afternoon without being jostled from one side to the other.”
tr_translation: “Yes, this is the only explanation, don't you understand? When we are in Berlin, we are in the city. That's why there are so many people and so many houses, that's why schools are full and you can't walk in the city center on a Saturday afternoon without being pushed and shoved.”
es_translation: —Yes, it's the only explanation, don't you see? When we are at home, in Berlin, we are in the city. That's why there are so many people and so many houses, and so many schools full of children, and you can't walk through the city center on a Saturday afternoon without the crowd pushing you.

en: ‘But we learned in geography class that in the countryside, where all the farmers are and the animals, and they grow all the food, there are huge areas like this where people live and work and send all the food to feed us.’ She looked out of the window again at the huge area spread out before her and the distances that existed between each of the huts. ‘This must be it. It’s the countryside. Perhaps this is our holiday home,’ she added hopefully.
vi: “Nhưng chúng ta đã học trong tiết địa lý là ở vùng nông thôn – toàn bộ những người nông đan sống ở đó, họ trồng tất cả các loại lương thực, nuôi cả con vật nữa – vẫn có những khu đất mênh mông như thế này để mọi người sinh sống, làm việc rồi mang tất cả lương thực đến cung cấp cho chúng ta.” Cô lại nhìn ra bên ngoài cửa sổ về phía khu đất mênh mông trải dài trước mặt và những khoảng trỗng giữa các gian trại. “Chắc hẳn là vậy rồi. Đây là vùng nông thôn. Có lẽ đây là khu nghỉ của gia đình chúng ta,” cô nói thêm tràn trề hy vọng.
tr: “Ama coğrafya dersinde, kırsalda çiftçilerin ve hayvanların olduğunu ve yiyecek yetiştirildiğini öğrendik, insanların yaşayıp çalıştıkları, bizi beslemek için ürünlerini yetiştirdikleri böyle kocaman bölgeler var.” Tekrar dışarı, gözlerinin önüne serilen uçsuz bucaksız alana ve her barakanın arasında bulunan mesafeye baktı. “Burası kırsal olmalı. Belki bu, yazlık evimizdir.” diye umutla ekledi.
es: —Pero en clase de Geografía nos enseñaron que en el campo, donde están los granjeros y los animales, y donde se cultivan los alimentos, hay zonas inmensas como ésta donde vive y trabaja la gente que envía a la ciudad todo lo que nosotros comemos. —Miró de nuevo por la ventana y contempló la gran extensión que se abría ante ella, fijándose en las distancias que había entre las cabañas—. Sí, debe de ser eso. Es el campo. A lo mejor ésta es nuestra casa de veraneo —añadió esperanzada.
vi_translation: “But we learned in geography class that in the countryside – where all the farmers live, they grow all kinds of crops, raise animals too – there are still vast lands like this for people to live, work, and then bring all the food to supply us.” She looked out the window again at the vast land stretching out in front of her and the empty spaces between the buildings. “That must be it. This is the countryside. Maybe this is our family's vacation spot,” she added, full of hope.
tr_translation: “But in geography class, we learned that in rural areas, there are farmers and animals, and food is grown; there are such vast regions where people live and work, growing their products to feed us.” She looked outside again, at the vast expanse that stretched out before her eyes and the distance between each shack. “This must be the countryside. Maybe this is our summer house,” she added hopefully.
es_translation: —But in Geography class, they taught us that in the countryside, where the farmers and animals are, and where food is grown, there are vast areas like this where people live and work, sending everything we eat to the city. —She looked out the window again and contemplated the vast expanse that opened before her, noting the distances between the cabins—. Yes, that must be it. It's the countryside. Maybe this is our summer house —she added hopefully.

en: With that remark she walked away, returning across the hallway to her bedroom and closing the door behind her, but she didn’t go back to arranging her dolls quite yet. Instead she sat down on the bed and a lot of things went through her head.
vi: Với lời nhận xét đó, vô bỏ ra ngoài đi qua hành lang trở lại phòng ngủ của mình và đóng cửa lại sau lưng, nhưng cô không tiếp tục sắp xếp búp bê ngay. Thay vì thế, cô ngồi xuống giường, biết bao nhiêu điều chạy ngang qua tâm trí .
tr: Bunu söyleyerek uzaklaştı. Koridorun karşısına, kendi odasına gitti ve kapıyı kapattı. Ama hemen bebeklerini yerleştirmeye koyulmadı. Bunun yerine yatağına oturdu ve aklından bir sürü şey geçti.
es: Y echó a andar, cruzó el pasillo, entró en su dormitorio y cerró la puerta, aunque no se puso a ordenar las muñecas enseguida. Se sentó en la cama y empezaron a pasarle muchas cosas por la cabeza.
vi_translation: With that remark, she left the room, walked down the hallway back to her bedroom, and closed the door behind her, but she did not immediately continue arranging the dolls. Instead, she sat down on the bed, with countless thoughts running through her mind.
tr_translation: Saying this, she walked away. She went across the corridor to her own room and closed the door. But she didn’t immediately start arranging her dolls. Instead, she sat on her bed and a lot of things went through her mind.
es_translation: And she started walking, crossed the hallway, entered her bedroom, and closed the door, although she didn't start arranging the dolls right away. She sat on the bed and many things started to go through her mind.

en: And one final thought came into her brother’s head as he watched the hundreds of people in the distance going about their business, and that was the fact that all of them – the small boys, the big boys, the fathers, the grandfathers, the uncles, the people who lived on their own on everybody’s road but didn’t seem to have any relatives at all – were wearing the same clothes as each other: a pair of grey striped pyjamas with a grey striped cap on their heads.
vi: Còn suy nghĩ cuối cùng đến trong đầu em trai cô khi cậu nhìn hàng trăm con người đang tất bật với những việc riêng của họ ở đằng xa kia, là tất cả những người đó – những cậu bé, thanh niên, những người cha, ngừơi ông, người chú, những người sống một mình giữa mọi người mà dường như chẳng có người thân thích nào cả - đều mặc cùng một kiểu quần áo hệt như nhau: một bộ pyjama sọc xám với một chiếc mũ sọc xám trên đầu.
tr: Kendi işleriyle ilgilenen yüzlerce kişiye bakarken kardeşinin aklına son bir düşünce geldi. Bir gerçek vardı. Küçük çocuklar, büyük çocuklar, babalar, büyükbabalar, amcalar, herkesten uzak duran ve akrabaları yokmuş gibi olan insanlar... hepsi aynı kıyafeti giyiyorlardı: Gri çizgili pijama ve başlarında gri çizgili bir takke...
es: Su hermano se acercó a la ventana y, mientras contemplaba a aquellos cientos de personas que trajinaban o deambulaban a lo lejos, reparó en que todos —los niños pequeños, los niños no tan pequeños, los padres, los abuelos, los tíos, los hombres que vivían en las calles y que no parecían tener familia— llevaban la misma ropa: un pijama gris de rayas y una gorra gris de rayas.
vi_translation: The last thought that came to her younger brother's mind as he looked at the hundreds of people bustling with their own affairs in the distance, was that all those people – the boys, the young men, the fathers, the grandfathers, the uncles, those living alone among everyone as if they had no relatives at all – were all wearing the same kind of clothes: a gray-striped pajama set with a gray-striped cap on their heads.
tr_translation: While looking at hundreds of people minding their own business, one last thought came to his brother's mind. There was one truth. Little children, big children, fathers, grandfathers, uncles, people who stayed away from everyone and acted as if they had no relatives... they were all wearing the same outfit: Gray striped pajamas and a gray striped cap on their heads...
es_translation: His brother approached the window and, while contemplating those hundreds of people bustling about or wandering in the distance, he noticed that everyone—the small children, the not-so-small children, the parents, the grandparents, the uncles, the men who lived on the streets and seemed to have no family—wore the same clothes: a gray striped pajama and a gray striped cap.

en: It was on this final morning, when the house looked empty and not like their real home at all, that the very last things they owned were put into suitcases and an official car with red-and-black flags on the front had stopped at their door to take them away.
vi: Phải đến buổi sáng cuối cùng ấy, khi ngôi nhà đã trống trơn và không còn giống tổ ấm thực sự của họ chút nào nữa, những món đồ sau chót mới được cho vào va li, và một chiếc xe hơi công vụ mui gắn cờ đen đỏ mới dừng lại trước cửa nàh đón họ.
tr: O son sabah, ev gerçek bir ev gibi değil de bomboş göründüğünde ve sahip oldukları son şeyler valizlere yerleştirildiğinde, kırmızı-siyah bayraklı bir araba kapılarında durup onları almış, götürmüştü.
es: Esa última mañana, cuando la residencia había quedado vacía y ya no parecía su hogar, metieron sus últimos objetos personales en las maletas y un coche oficial con banderitas rojas y negras en el capó se detuvo ante su puerta para llevárselos de allí.
vi_translation: It was not until that final morning, when the house was empty and no longer resembled their true home at all, that the last items were packed into the suitcase, and a government car with a black and red flag stopped in front of the house to pick them up.
tr_translation: That last morning, when the house no longer seemed like a real home but rather appeared empty, and their last belongings were packed into suitcases, a car with a red-black flag stopped at their door, picked them up, and took them away.
es_translation: That last morning, when the residence had been emptied and no longer felt like their home, they packed their last personal belongings into the suitcases and an official car with red and black flags on the hood stopped at their door to take them away from there.

en: Father held a hand in the air, which immediately caused the other men to fall silent. It was as if he was the conductor of a barbershop quartet.
vi: Cha giơ một tay lên trời, hành động đó ngay lập tức khiến tất cả những người khác im lặng. Y như thể ông là người điều khiển một nhóm tứ tấu.
tr: Baba bir elini havaya kaldırdı ve bu diğer adamların hemen susmalarını sağladı. Sanki bir orkestra şefiydi.
es: Padre alzó una mano e inmediatamente los demás guardaron silencio. Era como si él fuera el director de un conjunto de voces masculinas.
vi_translation: Dad raised one hand to the sky, and that action immediately silenced everyone else. It was as if he were conducting a quartet.
tr_translation: Father raised one hand into the air, and this immediately made the other men fall silent. It was as if he were a conductor.
es_translation: Father raised a hand and immediately the others fell silent. It was as if he were the conductor of a male choir.

en: ‘Come, come,’ said Father, wanting to have none of that. ‘Let’s have none of that,’ he said. ‘A home is not a building or a street or a city or something so artificial as bricks and mortar. A home is where one’s family is, isn’t that right?’
vi: “Thôi nào, thôi nào,” cha cậu nói, không muốn bàn thêm nữa. “Chúng ta sẽ không bàn về chuyện đó nữa,” ông nói. “Nhà không phải là một khối kiến trúc hay một con đường hay một thành phố hay một thứ gì đó nhân tạo như gạch ngói vôi vữa. Nhà là nơi mà gia đình chúng ta chung sống, chẳng phải thế sao con?”
tr: “Hadi hadi,” dedi baba, dinlemek bile istemeyerek. “Bunu duymak istemiyorum. Bir ev; bir sokak, bir şehir ya da tuğla ve harç gibi yapay şeyler değildir. Ev, insanın ailesinin olduğu yerdir, öyle değil mi?
es: —Vamos, vamos —dijo Padre, que no estaba para tonterías—. No me vengas con bobadas. Un hogar no es un edificio, ni una calle ni una ciudad; no tiene nada que ver con cosas tan materiales como los ladrillos y el cemento. Un hogar es donde está tu familia, ¿entiendes?
vi_translation: "Come on, come on," his father said, not wanting to discuss it any further. "We will not talk about that anymore," he said. "A home is not a structure or a street or a city or something artificial like bricks and mortar. A home is where our family lives together, isn't that right, son?"
tr_translation: “Come on, come on,” said the father, not even wanting to listen. “I don't want to hear this. A home is not an artificial thing like a house, a street, a city, or bricks and mortar. A home is where a person's family is, isn't it?”
es_translation: —Come on, come on —said Father, who was not in the mood for nonsense—. Don't come to me with foolishness. A home is not a building, nor a street, nor a city; it has nothing to do with material things like bricks and cement. A home is where your family is, do you understand?

en: ‘I remember when I was a child,’ said Father, ‘there were certain things that I didn’t want to do, but when my father said that it would be better for everyone if I did them, I just put my best foot forward and got on with them.’
vi: “Cha nhớ khi còn nhỏ,” cha nói, “cũng có việc này việc khác cha không muốn làm, nhưng ông nội con nói rằng nếu cha chịu làm thì sẽ là giải pháp tốt nhất cho tất cả mọi người, nên cha chỉ biết cố gắng hết sức để làm cho tốt những việc đó.”
tr: “Çocukluğumu hatırlıyorum...” dedi baba, “Yapmak istemediğim bazı şeyler vardı; ama babam, yapmamın herkes için daha iyi olacağını söylediğinde kararlı bir adım atıp işe girişirdim.
es: —Cuando yo era niño —dijo entonces— había ciertas cosas que no me gustaba hacer, pero si mi padre decía que lo mejor para todos era que las hiciera, yo me esmeraba y las hacía.
vi_translation: "I remember when I was young," Dad said, "there were things I didn't want to do, but your grandfather told me that if I did them, it would be the best solution for everyone, so I just tried my best to do those things well."
tr_translation: “I remember my childhood...” said the father, “There were some things I didn't want to do; but when my father said that doing them would be better for everyone, I would take a determined step and get to work.”
es_translation: —When I was a child —he said then— there were certain things I didn't like to do, but if my father said that the best thing for everyone was for me to do them, I would strive and do them.

en: ‘Oh, I don’t know,’ said Father, shrugging his shoulders. ‘It’s neither here nor there anyway. I was just a child and didn’t know what was for the best. Sometimes, for example, I didn’t want to stay at home and finish my schoolwork; I wanted to be out on the streets, playing with my friends just like you do, and I look back now and see how foolish I was.’
vi: “Ôi, cha không nhớ rõ nữa,” cha cậu nhún vai nói. “Cũng không phải việc gì to tát. Lúc đó cha chỉ là một đứa trẻ nên không biết cái gì là tốt nhất. Chẳng hạn như đôi khi cha không muốn ở nhà làm bài tập; cha muốn chạy ra ngoài đường chơi với bạn, giống như con vậy đó, và giờ khi nhìn lại cha thấy mình mới ngu ngốc làm sao.”
tr: “Şey, bilmiyorum,” dedi baba omuzlarını silkerek. “Şu anda o kadar da önemli değil. Sadece küçük bir çocuktum ve neyin daha doğru olduğunu bilmiyordum. Mesela bazen evde kalıp ödevlerimi bitirmek yerine, tıpkı senin gibi dışarıda arkadaşlarımla oynamak isterdim. Şimdi geçmişe bakıp ne kadar aptal olduğumu görüyorum.
es: —Pues... no sé. —Se encogió de hombros—. Cosas normales de la vida diaria. Sólo era un niño y no sabía qué era lo mejor para mí. A veces, por ejemplo, no quería quedarme en casa a terminar los deberes, quería salir a la calle para jugar con mis amigos, igual que tú. Ahora miro hacia atrás y veo que era una tontería.
vi_translation: “Oh, I don't remember clearly,” his father shrugged and said. “It's not a big deal anyway. At that time, I was just a child, so I didn't know what was best. For example, sometimes I didn't want to stay at home doing homework; I wanted to run outside and play with friends, just like you, and now looking back, I see how foolish I was.”
tr_translation: “Well, I don't know,” said the father, shrugging his shoulders. “It's not that important right now. I was just a little kid and didn't know what was right. For example, sometimes instead of staying home and finishing my homework, I wanted to play outside with my friends just like you. Now, looking back, I see how foolish I was.”
es_translation: —Well... I don't know. —He shrugged—. Normal everyday things. I was just a child and didn't know what was best for me. Sometimes, for example, I didn't want to stay home to finish my homework; I wanted to go out and play with my friends, just like you. Now I look back and see that it was foolish.

en: After a few silent and uncomfortable minutes Father stood up slowly from the seat beside him and walked back behind the desk, laying his cigarette on an ashtray.
vi: Sau một khoảng im lặng ngột ngạt, cha cậu từ từ đừng dậy khỏi chiếc ghế bên cạnh cậu rồi trở lại chỗ ngồi sau bàn, đặt điếu thuốc trên tay xuống cái gạt tàn.
tr: Huzursuz bir sessizlikten sonra baba yavaşça oturduğu koltuktan kalkıp masanın arkasına geçti ve sigarasını kül tablasına bıraktı.
es: Tras unos minutos de incómodo silencio, Padre se levantó despacio del sillón y volvió a su asiento del escritorio, dejando el cigarrillo en un cenicero.
vi_translation: After an oppressive silence, his father slowly stood up from the chair next to him and returned to his seat behind the desk, placing the cigarette in his hand into the ashtray.
tr_translation: After an uneasy silence, the father slowly got up from the chair he was sitting in, walked behind the table, and placed his cigarette in the ashtray.
es_translation: After a few minutes of awkward silence, Father slowly got up from the armchair and returned to his seat at the desk, leaving the cigarette in an ashtray.

en: ‘I wonder if you are being very brave,’ he said quietly after a moment, as if he was debating the matter in his head, ‘rather than merely disrespectful. Perhaps that’s not such a bad thing.’
vi: “Cha băn khoăn không biết là con đang quá dũng cảm,” ông trầm tĩnh nói sau giây lát, giống như thể ông đang cân nhắc sự vệc ở trong đầu, “hay chỉ là thiếu tôn trọng. Chắc là con không hư hỏng đến thế chứ.”
tr: “Merak ediyorum, acaba çok mu yüreklisin?” dedi bir süre sonra sakin bir sesle. Sanki konuyu kafasında tartışır gibiydi. “Yani düşüncelerini bu kadar açık söylemen... Belki bu o kadar kötü bir şey değildir.
es: —No sé si pensar que eres muy valiente —dijo con voz queda al cabo de un momento— o muy irrespetuoso. Quizá seas muy valiente, lo cual no es malo.
vi_translation: “I wonder if you are being too brave,” he calmly said after a moment, as if he were weighing the matter in his mind, “or just disrespectful. Surely you are not that spoiled.”
tr_translation: “I wonder, are you very brave?” he said in a calm voice after a while. It was as if he was debating the topic in his mind. “I mean, speaking your thoughts so openly... Maybe it's not such a bad thing.”
es_translation: —I don't know whether to think that you are very brave —he said in a quiet voice after a moment— or very disrespectful. Maybe you are very brave, which is not a bad thing.

en: ‘Well, at least not as we understand the term,’ Father continued. ‘But you shouldn’t be worrying about them right now. They’re nothing to do with you. You have nothing whatsoever in common with them. Just settle into your new home and be good, that’s all I ask. Accept the situation in which you find yourself and everything will be so much easier.’
vi: “Đúng rồi, ít nhất không giống như cách chúng ta vẫn hiểu về con người,” cha cậu tiếp tục. “Nhưng giờ thì con không nên lo lắng về họ. Họ chẳng liên quan gì đến con cả. Con chẳng có gì chung với họ hết. Hãy ổn định cuộc sống ở ngôi nhà mới của con và tỏ ra thật ngoan ngoãn, đó là tất cả những gì cha yêu cầu con. Chấp nhận hoàn cảnh mà con đang sống, rồi mọi thứ sẽ trở nên dễ dàng hơn rất nhiều.”
tr: “En azından bizim, sözcüğü anladığımız anlamda değil,” diye devam etti baba, “ama şu anda onlar için endişelenmemelisin. Seninle ilgileri yok. Onlarla hiçbir ortak noktan olamaz. Sadece yeni evine yerleş ve uslu ol. Senden tek istediğim bu. içinde bulunduğun durumu kabullenirsen her şey senin için daha kolay olacak.
es: —Al menos no son lo que nosotros entendemos por personas —explicó Padre—. Pero no debes preocuparte. No tienen nada que ver contigo. No tienes absolutamente nada en común con ellos. Instálate en tu nueva casa y pórtate bien, eso es lo único que te pido. Acepta la situación en que te encuentras y todo resultará mucho más fácil.
vi_translation: “That's right, at least not in the way we usually understand humans,” his father continued. “But now you shouldn't worry about them. They have nothing to do with you. You have nothing in common with them. Settle into your new home and behave well, that's all I ask of you. Accept the circumstances you are living in, and everything will become much easier.”
tr_translation: “At least not in the sense we understand the word,” continued the father, “but right now you shouldn't worry about them. They have nothing to do with you. You can have nothing in common with them. Just settle into your new home and behave. That's all I ask of you. If you accept the situation you're in, everything will be easier for you.”
es_translation: —At least they are not what we understand by people —explained Father—. But you should not worry. They have nothing to do with you. You have absolutely nothing in common with them. Settle into your new house and behave well, that is the only thing I ask of you. Accept the situation you are in and everything it will be much easier.

en: ‘Everything here is horrible,’ he said out loud, even though there was no one present to hear him, but somehow it made him feel better to hear the words stated anyway. ‘I hate this house, I hate my room and I even hate the paintwork. I hate it all. Absolutely everything.’
vi: “Mọi thứ ở đây thật kinh khủng,” cậu hét to, mặc cho chẳng có ai ở đây nghe cậu nói, nhưng dù sao cậu cảm thấy dễ chịu hơn khi nghe những lời đó thốt ra. “Tôi ghét ngôi nhà, toi ghét căn phòng này và tôi ghét luôn cả lớp sơn tường. Tôi ghét tất cả. Tất tần tật”
tr: “Burada her şey berbat!” dedi yüksek sesle, onu duyacak kimse olmadığını biliyordu, ama o sözcükleri duymak kendini daha iyi hissetmesini sağladı. “Bu evden nefret ediyorum. Odamdan nefret ediyorum. Boyadan bile nefret ediyorum. Hepsinden nefret ediyorum. Kesinlikle her şeyden!..
es: —Aquí todo es horrible —dijo en voz alta, aunque estaba solo en la habitación, pero oírse decirlo le hacía sentir mejor—. Odio esta casa, odio mi habitación y hasta odio la pintura. Lo odio todo. Absolutamente todo.
vi_translation: “Everything here is terrible,” he shouted, even though no one was there to hear him, but he felt better hearing those words come out. “I hate the house, I hate this room, and I even hate the wall paint. I hate everything. Absolutely everything.”
tr_translation: “Everything is terrible here!” he said loudly, knowing there was no one to hear him, but hearing those words made him feel better. “I hate this house. I hate my room. I even hate the paint. I hate everything. Absolutely everything!..”
es_translation: —Everything here is horrible —he said out loud, even though he was alone in the room, but hearing himself say it made him feel better—. I hate this house, I hate my room, and I even hate the paint. I hate everything. Absolutely everything.

en: ‘Well, you’ve been brought here against your will, just like I have. If you ask me, we’re all in the same boat. And it’s leaking.’
vi: “Ừm, cậu bị đưa tới đây hoàn toàn ngoài ý muốn, tôi cũng y vậy thôi. Nếu cậu hỏi tôi thì, tất cả chúng ta đang ở trên một con thuyền. Và nó đang bị thủng.
tr: “Buraya isteğin dışında getirildin, tıpkı benim gibi. Eğer bana sorarsan hepimiz aynı gemideyiz ve gemi su alıyor.
es: —Bueno, te han traído aquí contra tu voluntad, igual que a mí. Si quieres saber mi opinión, estamos todos en el mismo barco. Y el barco hace agua.
vi_translation: “Um, you were brought here completely unintentionally, and so was I. If you ask me, we are all on the same boat. And it is leaking.”
tr_translation: “You were brought here against your will, just like me. If you ask me, we're all in the same boat and the boat is taking on water.”
es_translation: —Well, they brought you here against your will, just like me. If you want my opinion, we're all in the same boat. And the boat is leaking.

en: She looked away from him for a few silent moments and shook her head sadly before turning back to face him. ‘Your father knows what is for the best,’ she said. ‘You must trust in that.’
vi: Cô nhìn tránh sang hướng khác tỏng vài giây yên lặng rồi lắc đầu buồn bã trước khi quay lại đối diện với cậu. “Cha cậu biết cái gì là tốt nhất,” cô nói. “Cậu phải tin điều đó.”
tr: Bir an gözleri daldı ve üzgünce başını salladı, sonra dönüp onun yüzüne baktı. “Baban neyin doğru olduğunu biliyor,” dedi, “ona güvenmelisin.
es: La mujer desvió la mirada, guardó silencio unos instantes y sacudió la cabeza con tristeza antes de decir: —Tu padre sabe qué nos conviene. Debes confiar en él.
vi_translation: She looked away in another direction for a few seconds of silence, then shook her head sadly before turning back to face him. "Your father knows what's best," she said. "You have to believe that."
tr_translation: For a moment, his eyes glazed over and he shook his head sadly, then he turned and looked at her face. "Your father knows what is right," he said, "you must trust him."
es_translation: The woman averted her gaze, remained silent for a few moments, and shook her head sadly before saying: —Your father knows what is best for us. You must trust him.

en: ‘There are many things your father has done,’ she said. ‘Many things of which you should be proud. If it wasn’t for your father, where would I be now after all?’
vi: “Cha cậu đã làm rất nhiều điều,” cô nói. “Trong đó có rất nhiều điều cậu nên thấy tự hào. Nếu không nhờ có cha cậu thì rốt cuộc giờ này tôi sẽ đang ở đâu?”
tr: “Babanın yaptığı birçok şey var,” dedi kadın. “Gurur duyman gereken birçok şey. Eğer baban olmasaydı ben şu anda nerede olurdum?
es: —Tu padre ha hecho muchas cosas —dijo Maña—. Muchas cosas de las que deberías enorgullecerte. De no ser por tu padre, ¿dónde estaría yo ahora?
vi_translation: “Your father has done many things,” she said. “Among them, there are many things you should be proud of. If it weren't for your father, where would I be now?”
tr_translation: “There are many things your father has done,” said the woman. “Many things you should be proud of. If it weren't for your father, where would I be right now?”
es_translation: —Your father has done many things —said Maña—. Many things you should be proud of. If it weren't for your father, where would I be now?

en: ‘But why?’ he asked, frowning. ‘I’m only saying what I feel. I’m allowed to do that, aren’t I?’
vi: “Nhưng tại sao chứ?” cậu cau có hỏi lại. “Tôi chỉ nói những điều tôi cảm thấy thôi mà. Tôi được phép làm điều đó, không phải như thế sao?”

es: —Me acuerdo de cuando empezó la Gran Guerra —comentó el Abuelo con orgullo, contemplando el fuego y moviendo la cabeza—. Recuerdo el día que llegaste a casa y nos anunciaste que te habías alistado. Yo estaba seguro de. que te pasaría algo.

After all the injustices done to your country, you are helping it regain its honor. Beyond all the punishments...”

To see how you help your country regain its pride after the great injustices that have been committed against it. The countless punishments...

es: —¿Guapo? —repitió la Abuela, inclinándose hacia delante y mirando a su nuera como si ésta hubiera perdido el juicio—. ¿Has dicho guapo? ¡Qué ingenua eres! ¿Crees que eso es lo que importa? ¿Estar guapo? —¿Y yo? ¿Estoy guapo con mi disfraz de presentador?

en: ‘A patriot indeed!’ she cried out. ‘The people you have to dinner in this house. Why, it makes me sick. And to see you in that uniform makes me want to tear the eyes from my head!’ she added before storming out of the house and slamming the door behind her.

es: —¡Eso, un patriota! —replicó ella—. Mira qué gente viene a cenar a esta casa. Me dan ganas de vomitar. ¡Y cuando te veo con ese uniforme me dan ganas de arrancarme los ojos! —añadió antes de marcharse furiosa y cerrar con un portazo.

tr_translation: “Patriot, is that so?” shouted the grandmother. “The people you invited to this house for dinner... This makes me sick. And seeing you in that uniform makes me want to gouge my eyes out,” she added, before quickly storming out of the house without slamming the door behind her.

vi: Và cậu vẫn cứ ao ước rằng cậu có thể trở lại nhà ở Berlin, dù cho những ký ức về nơi đó đang dần trở nên mờ nhạt và, trongkhi cậu vẫn thực lòng muốn làm, nhiều tuần trôi qua kể từ ngày cậu nghĩ về việc viết thêm một lá thư cho ông hay bà nội, đừng nói gì đến việc thực sự ngồi xuống mà viết một lá thư.
tr: Berlin’e dönebilmeyi hâlâ umuyordu; ama oranın anıları artık silinmeye başlamıştı. Büyükbaba ve büyükanneye değil oturup yazmak, yeni bir mektup yollama düşüncesi bile haftalardır aklına gelmemişti.
es: Y seguía anhelando volver a su casa de Berlín, aunque los recuerdos de la vida allí empezaban a difuminarse. Llevaba varias semanas sin proponerse siquiera enviar otra carta al Abuelo o la Abuela, y, por lo tanto, sin sentarse a escribirla.
vi_translation: And he still wished that he could return to his home in Berlin, even though the memories of that place were gradually fading and, while he still genuinely wanted to, many weeks had passed since the day he thought about writing another letter to his grandparents, let alone actually sitting down to write one.
tr_translation: He still hoped to be able to return to Berlin; but the memories of that place had already begun to fade. For weeks, the thought of not only sitting down to write to Grandpa and Grandma but even sending a new letter hadn't crossed his mind.
es_translation: And he continued longing to return to his home in Berlin, although the memories of life there were beginning to fade. It had been several weeks since he had even considered sending another letter to Grandpa or Grandma, and, therefore, without sitting down to write it.

en: ‘Those things are useless to you,’ insisted the teacher. ‘A sound understanding of the social sciences is far more important in this day and age.’
vi: “Những thư sđó đều vô ích đối với cậu,” ông thầy quả quyết. “Thời này một kiến thức đầy đủ về khoa học xã hội quan trọng hơn nhiều.”
tr: “O şeylerin sana faydası yok,” diye ısrar etti öğretmen. “Bu çağda, bu zamanda sosyal bilimleri iyi anlamak çok daha önemli.
es: —Eso no te servirá para nada —insistía el profesor—. Hoy en día es mucho más importante un profundo conocimiento de las ciencias sociales.
vi_translation: “Those letters are all useless to you,” the teacher asserted. “These days, a comprehensive knowledge of social sciences is much more important.”
tr_translation: "Those things are of no use to you," insisted the teacher. "In this age, understanding social sciences well is much more important."
es_translation: —That won't be of any use to you —the professor insisted—. Nowadays, a deep understanding of the social sciences is much more important.

en: There was no point doing any exploring inside. After all, this wasn’t like the house in Berlin, which he could just about remember had hundreds of nooks and crannies, and strange little rooms, not to mention five floors if you counted the basement and the little room at the top with the window he needed to stand on tiptoes to see through. No, this was a terrible house for exploration. If there was any to be done it would have to be done outside.
vi: Thật chẳng bĩ làm bất kỳ một cuộc khám phá nào trong ngôi nhà này. Xét cho cùng, ở đây đâu giống ngôi nhà ở Berlin, nơi cậu nhớ có hàng trăm ngóc ngách xó xỉnh và những căn phòng nhỏ lạ lùng, chưa kể có những năm tầng nhà nếu tính cả tầng hầm và căn phòng nhỏ xíu ở tầng thượng với ô cửa sổ mà cậu phải kiễng chân hết cỡ mới nhìn thấy được ra ngoài. Không, đây là một ngôi nhà không tệ để khám phá. Nếu muốn làm một cuộc khám phá thì phải thực hiện ở bên ngoài.
tr: İçeride araştırma yapmanın anlamı yoktu. Ne de olsa burası Berlin’deki ev gibi değildi. Orada yüzlerce köşe bucak ve garip küçük odalar hatırlıyordu. Tabii bodrumu ve penceresinden dışarıyı görebilmek için parmak uçlarında yükselmek zorunda kaldığı tepedeki küçük odayı da sayarsak toplam beş katı söylemek gereksizdi. Hayır burası araştırma için berbat bir evdi. Eğer yapılacak bir keşif varsa ancak dışarıda olabilirdi.
es: No tenía sentido explorar dentro. Al fin y al cabo, aquella casa no era como la de Berlín, que tenía cientos de rincones, recovecos y extraños cuartitos, por no mencionar los cinco pisos —contando el sótano y la buhardilla en lo alto del edificio, con aquella ventana por la que sólo podía mirar si se ponía de puntillas—. No, aquella casa era malísima para explorar. Si quería jugar a los exploradores, tendría que salir fuera.
vi_translation: It's really not worth making any exploration in this house. After all, this place is nothing like the house in Berlin, where you remember there were hundreds of nooks and crannies and strange little rooms, not to mention the five floors if you count the basement and the tiny room at the top with a window you had to stand on tiptoe to see out of. No, this is not a bad house to explore. If you want to make an exploration, you have to do it outside.
tr_translation: There was no point in doing research inside. After all, this place was not like the house in Berlin. There, he remembered hundreds of nooks and crannies and strange little rooms. Of course, it was unnecessary to mention the five floors, including the basement and the small room at the top where he had to stand on tiptoe to see outside through the window. No, this was a terrible house for research. If there was any discovery to be made, it could only be outside.
es_translation: There was no point in exploring inside. After all, that house was not like the one in Berlin, which had hundreds of corners, nooks, and strange little rooms, not to mention the five floors —counting the basement and the attic at the top of the building, with that window you could only look through if you stood on tiptoe—. No, that house was terrible for exploring. If he wanted to play explorers, he would have to go outside.

en: Of course sometimes the two groups mixed. He’d often seen the people from his side of the fence on the other side of the fence, and when he watched it was clear that they were in charge. The pyjama people all jumped to attention whenever the soldiers approached and sometimes they fell to the ground and sometimes they didn’t even get up and had to be carried away instead.
vi: Dĩ nhiên đôi khi hai nhóm người cũng hòa vào nhau. Cậu cũng hay nhìn thấy người của phía bên này hàng rào lại ở phía bên kia và khi quan sát cậu thấy rõ rằng họ là người điều khiển. những người mặc pyjama luôn giật bắn mình cảnh giác bất kể khi nào những người lính đến gần, đôi khi họ ngã lăn xuống đất và đôi khi họ thậm chí không đứng dậy mà thay vào đó phải để người khác mang đi.
tr: Elbette bazen iki grup karışıyordu. Kendi taralında gördüğü insanları, tel örgünün karşı tarafında da sık sık görmüştü. Yetkinin onlarda olduğu çok açıktı. Askerler ne zaman yaklaşsa pijamalı insanlar hemen hazır ola geçiyorlardı. Bazen yere düşüyorlar, toparlanıp kalkamıyorlar ve taşınmaları gerekiyordu.
es: A veces los dos grupos se mezclaban, como era lógico. Bruno había visto muchas veces a personas uniformadas al otro lado de la alambrada, y observándolas se dio cuenta de que eran quienes mandaban. Los del pijama se ponían en posición de firmes cuando se les acercaban los soldados, y a veces se caían al suelo y ni siquiera se levantaban y tenían que llevárselos.
vi_translation: Of course, sometimes the two groups of people would mingle with each other. You would often see people from this side of the fence on the other side, and upon observation, you could clearly see that they were the ones in control. The people in pajamas would always startle and be on guard whenever the soldiers approached; sometimes they would fall to the ground, and sometimes they wouldn't even get up, instead needing others to carry them away.
tr_translation: Of course, sometimes the two groups would mix. The people he saw on his own side, he often saw on the other side of the barbed wire as well. It was very clear that the authority was with them. Whenever the soldiers approached, the people in pajamas would immediately stand at attention. Sometimes they would fall to the ground, unable to get up, and needed to be carried.
es_translation: Sometimes the two groups mixed, as was logical. Bruno had often seen uniformed people on the other side of the fence, and by observing them, he realized that they were the ones in charge. The ones in pajamas would stand at attention when the soldiers approached, and sometimes they would fall to the ground and not even get up, and they had to be taken away.

en: ‘Presented on the occasion of the opening of …’ He hesitated. ‘Out-With Camp,’ he continued, stumbling over the name as usual. ‘June nineteen forty.’
vi: “Kỷ niệm nhân dịp khai trương...” cậu ngưng lại. “Trại Ao Tuýt,” cậu đọc tiếp, bị vấp khi đọc tới cái tên đó như mọi lần. “Tháng 06. 1940.”
tr: “Açılış nedeniyle sunulmuştur. Tereddüt etti. “Out-With Kampı” Her zamanki gibi ismi söylerken zorlanmıştı. Devam etti: “Haziran dokuz yüz kırk
es: «Obsequiado con motivo de la inauguración... —vaciló un instante— del Campo de Auchviz —continuó, titubeando un poco como solía ocurrirle—. Junio de 1940.»
vi_translation: “Commemorating the grand opening...” he paused. “Camp Ao Tuýt,” he continued, stumbling over the name as usual. “June 1940.”
tr_translation: “Presented on the occasion of the opening. “ He hesitated. He struggled, as usual, to pronounce the name "Out-With Camp." He continued: "June nineteen forty"
es_translation: "Presented on the occasion of the inauguration... —he hesitated for a moment— of the Auchviz Camp —he continued, stumbling a bit as he often did—. June 1940."

en: He sat down on the ground on his side of the fence and crossed his legs like the little boy and wished that he had brought some chocolate with him or perhaps a pastry that they could share.
vi: Cậu ngồi bệt xuống đất ở phía bên này hàng rào và khoanh chân lại giống chú bé ấy, ước gì mình mang theo một ít sô cô la hay bánh ngọt để hai đứa có thể cùng ăn.
tr: Tel örgünün dibine oturdu ve küçük çocuk gibi bağdaş kurdu. Yanında biraz çikolata getirmiş olmayı diledi ya da paylaşabilecekleri bir çörek.
es: Así pues, se sentó en el suelo, en su lado de la alambrada, cruzando las piernas igual que el otro niño, y lamentó no haber llevado un poco de chocolate o quizá una pasta que podrían haber compartido.
vi_translation: He sat down on the ground on this side of the fence and crossed his legs like that boy, wishing he had brought some chocolate or sweets so they could share.
tr_translation: He sat down by the fence and crossed his legs like a little child. He wished he had brought some chocolate or a pastry they could share.
es_translation: So then, he sat on the ground, on his side of the fence, crossing his legs just like the other boy, and regretted not having brought some chocolate or perhaps a pastry that they could have shared.

en: ‘There are dozens of Shmuels on this side of the fence,’ said the little boy. ‘Hundreds probably. I wish I had a name all of my own.’
vi: “có hàng tá Shmuel ở phía bên này của hàng rào đấy,” chú bé nói. “Có khi là hàng trăn ấy chứ. Ước gì tớ có một cái tên hoàn toàn riêng của mình.”
tr: “Tel örgünün bu tarafında düzinelerce Shmuel var,” dedi küçük çocuk. “Belki de yüzlerce. Keşke sadece kendime ait bir adım olsaydı.
es: —Pues en este lado de la alambrada hay montones de Shmuels. Cientos, seguramente. A mí me gustaría tener mi propio nombre.
vi_translation: “There are dozens of Shmuels on this side of the fence,” the boy said. “Maybe even hundreds. I wish I had a completely unique name.”
tr_translation: "There are dozens of Shmuels on this side of the wire," said the little boy. "Maybe even hundreds. I wish I had a name that was just my own."
es_translation: —Well, on this side of the fence there are heaps of Shmuels. Hundreds, surely. I would like to have my own name.

en: ‘The Fury has something he wants to discuss with me,’ said Father, who was allowed to interrupt Mother even if no one else was. ‘I just got a phone call this afternoon. The only time he can make it is Thursday evening and he’s invited himself to dinner.’
vi: “Quốc trưởng có chuyện muốn bàn bạc với anh,” cha cậu nói, cha được phép ngắt lời mẹ ngay cả khi chẳng ai khác được phép làm thế. “Anh mới vừa nhận điện thoại chiều nay. Thời gian duy nhất ngài có thể dành cho việc đó là tối thứ năm và ngài tự đề nghị được tới dùng bữa tối.”
tr: “Sen istersen planlarını değiştirebilirsin,” demişti anne, “ama ben tiyatroya gitmek için düzenlemeler yaptım...” “Fury’nin benimle konuşmak istediği şeyler var,” diyerek sözünü kesmişti baba. Kimse yapamasa da onun, annenin sözünü kesme hakkı vardı. “Bugün öğleden sonra bir telefon aldım. Sadece perşembe akşamı gelebilirmiş ve kendini yemeğe davet etti.
es: —El Furias quiere hablar de un asunto conmigo —dijo Padre, que era el único autorizado para interrumpir a Madre—. Acabo de recibir una llamada esta tarde. Sólo le va bien el jueves por la noche y vendrá a cenar.
vi_translation: “The Head of State has something he wants to discuss with you,” his father said, as he was allowed to interrupt his mother even when no one else was. “You just received a call this afternoon. The only time he can spare for it is Thursday evening, and he himself suggested coming over for dinner.”
tr_translation: "The Fury has things he wants to discuss with me," Father had interrupted. No one else could, but he had the right to interrupt Mother. "I received a phone call this afternoon. He can only come on Thursday evening and has invited himself to dinner."
es_translation: —The Fury wants to discuss a matter with me —said Father, who was the only one authorized to interrupt Mother—. I just received a call this afternoon. Thursday night is the only time that works for him, and he will come for dinner.

en: ‘Oh my,’ said Mother again, standing up and counting in her head the number of things she had to organize before Thursday, which was only two evenings away. The house would have to be cleaned from top to bottom, the windows washed, the dining-room table stained and varnished, the food ordered, the maid’s and butler’s uniforms washed and pressed, and the crockery and glasses polished until they sparkled.
vi: “Ôi trời,” mẹ cậu thốt lên, đứng dậy và tính toán trong đầu vô số việc bà phải vun vén trước thứ năm, chỉ còn hai đêm nữa thôi. Ngôi nhà sẽ phải được cọ sạch từ trên xuống dưới, lau chùi cửa sổ, đánh véc ni và sơn bóng bộ bàn ăn, chuẩn bị thức ăn, giặt ủi đồng phục của quản gia và người hầu, và đánh đồ sành sứ thủy tinh cho tới khi thật sáng bóng lên.
tr: “Tanrım!..” demişti anne, tekrar ayağa kalkıp perşembeden önce ayarlaması gereken şeyleri kafasında hesaplayarak. Sadece iki gece kalmıştı. Evin tepeden tırnağa temizlenmesi gerekiyordu; pencereler silinmeli, yemek masası verniklenip cilalanmalı, yiyecekler sipariş edilmeli, hizmetçi ve uşağın üniformaları yıkanıp ütülenmeli, çanak çömlek ve bardaklar pırıl pırıl parlayana kadar ovulmalıydı.
es: —¡Cielos! —repitió Madre, levantándose y calculando mentalmente todo lo que tenía que organizar antes del jueves, para el que sólo faltaban dos días. Habría que limpiar la casa a fondo (incluidos los cristales), teñir y barnizar la mesa del comedor, encargar la comida, lavar y planchar los uniformes de la criada y el mayordomo, y dar brillo a la vajilla y la cristalería hasta que destellaran.
vi_translation: “Oh dear,” his mother exclaimed, standing up and calculating in her head the countless tasks she had to manage before Thursday, with only two nights left. The house would have to be scrubbed from top to bottom, windows cleaned, the dining table varnished and polished, food prepared, the uniforms of the butler and maid laundered, and the china and glassware polished until they shone brightly.
tr_translation: “My God!..” said the mother, standing up again and calculating in her head the things she needed to arrange before Thursday. There were only two nights left. The house needed to be cleaned from top to bottom; the windows had to be wiped, the dining table had to be varnished and polished, the groceries had to be ordered, the maid's and butler's uniforms had to be washed and ironed, and the dishes and glasses had to be scrubbed until they sparkled.
es_translation: —repeated Mother, standing up and mentally calculating everything she had to organize before Thursday, which was only two days away. The house would need to be thoroughly cleaned (including the windows), the dining table would need to be stained and varnished, the food ordered, the maid's and butler's uniforms washed and ironed, and the dishes and glassware polished until they sparkled.

en: Somehow, despite the fact that the list seemed to grow longer and longer all the time, Mother managed to get everything finished on time, although she commented over and over again that the evening would be a greater success if some people helped out a little bit more around the house.
vi: Danh sách đó dường như càng lúc càng dài thêm trong suốt thời gian chuẩn bị, bằng cách nào đó mẹ cậu đã xoay xở để mọi việc xong xuôi kịp lúc, mặc dù bà cứ than thở hoài rằng buổi tối ấy sẽ thành công hơn nếu một số người chịu ở nhà giúp đỡ thêm một chút nữa.
tr: Liste her geçen saniye uzadıkça uzuyor gibi görünse de anne her şeyi zamanında bitirmeyi becermişti; yine de bazıları biraz daha yardımcı olsa gecenin daha başarılı olacağını tekrarlayarak söylenip duruyordu.
es: De un modo u otro, pese a que la lista parecía crecer y crecer, Madre consiguió terminarlo todo a tiempo, aunque no paraba de decir que la velada habría tenido el éxito asegurado si ciertas personas hubieran ayudado un poco más a prepararlo todo.
vi_translation: The list seemed to grow longer and longer during the preparation time, yet somehow his mother managed to get everything done in time, even though she kept lamenting that the evening would be more successful if some people stayed home to help a bit more.
tr_translation: Although the list seemed to be getting longer with each passing second, the mother had managed to finish everything on time; still, some kept complaining that if others had helped a bit more, the night would have been more successful.
es_translation: One way or another, even though the list seemed to grow and grow, Mother managed to finish everything on time, although she kept saying that the evening would have been a guaranteed success if certain people had helped a little more with the preparations.

en: ‘Now, children,’ said Father, sitting behind his desk and looking from his son to his daughter and back again as they stood before him. ‘You know that there is a very special evening ahead of us, don’t you?’
vi: “Nào, các con,” cha cậu nói, ông đang ngồi sau bàn làm việc, hết nhìn cậu con trai lại qua cô con gái trong lúc hai chị em đứng trước mặt ông. “Các con biết rằng trước mắt chúng ta là một buổi tối vô cùng đặc biệt, phải không nào?”
tr: “Şimdi çocuklar,” demişti baba, masasının arkasında oturmuş, gözlerini karşısında duran oğlundan kızına ve tekrar diğerine çevirerek, “önümüzde çok önemli bir akşam var, biliyorsunuz, değil mi?”
es: —A ver, niños —dijo Padre sentándose detrás de su escritorio y mirando alternativamente a sus hijos, de pie e inmóviles frente a él—. Ya sabéis que esta velada es muy especial, ¿verdad?
vi_translation: "Come on, kids," said their father, who was sitting behind the desk, looking from his son to his daughter as the two siblings stood before him. "You know that we have a very special evening ahead of us, don't you?"
tr_translation: “Now children,” said the father, sitting behind his desk, shifting his gaze from his son to his daughter and back again, “we have a very important evening ahead of us, you know that, right?”
es_translation: —Let's see, children —said Father, sitting behind his desk and looking alternately at his children, standing still in front of him—. You know that this evening is very special, right?

en: ‘Then there are a number of ground rules which need to be set down before we begin.’ Father was a big believer in ground rules. Whenever there was a special or important occasion in the house, more of them were created.
vi: “Giờ thì có một số quy định cơ bản cần được ghi nhớ trước khi bắt đầu.” Cha cậu lòa người hết sức tin tưởng vào những điều cơ bản. bất cứ khi nào có dịp gì quan trọng hay đặc biệt trong nhà là lại có thêm những quy định được sáng tạo ra.
tr: “Başlamadan önce konulması gereken temel kurallar var. Babası temel kurallara inanırdı. Evde ne zaman özel veya önemli bir olay olsa, daha çok kural yaratılırdı.
es: —Por tanto, hay una serie de reglas básicas que estableceremos de antemano. Padre era muy partidario de las reglas básicas. Siempre que había una ocasión especial o importante en la casa, establecía algunas nuevas.
vi_translation: “Now there are some basic rules that need to be remembered before we start.” Your father was someone who believed deeply in the basics. Whenever there was an important or special occasion at home, new rules would be created.
tr_translation: “There are fundamental rules that need to be established before starting.” His father believed in basic rules. Whenever there was a special or important event at home, more rules would be created.
es_translation: —Therefore, there are a series of basic rules that we will establish beforehand. Father was very supportive of basic rules. Whenever there was a special or important occasion at home, he would establish some new ones.

en: ‘Number one,’ said Father. ‘When the Fury arrives you will stand in the hall quietly and prepare to greet him. You do not speak until he speaks to you and then you reply in a clear tone, enunciating each word precisely. Is that understood?’
vi: “Thứ nhất,” cha cậu nói. “khi Quốc trưởng tới, các con sẽ trật tự đứng ở sảnh và chuẩn bị chào ngài. Các con không được nói gì cho tới khi ngài nói với các con và rồi các con đáp lời bằng giọng thật rõ ràng, phát âm từng từ một cách chính xác. Đã rõ chưa?”
tr: “Birinci kural,” demişti baba, “Fury geldiğinde koridorda sessizce durup onu selamlamayı bekleyeceksiniz. O sizinle konuşana kadar konuşmayacaksınız ve net bir sesle cevap vereceksiniz, her sözcüğü doğru kullanarak. Anlaşıldı mı?
es: —Regla número uno —dijo—. Cuando llegue el Furias, os pondréis de pie en el recibidor, en silencio, y os prepararéis para saludarlo. No diréis nada hasta que él se dirija a vosotros, y entonces contestaréis con voz clara, articulando bien las palabras. ¿Entendido?
vi_translation: "First," your father said. "When the Head of State arrives, you will stand orderly in the hall and prepare to greet him. You must not say anything until he speaks to you, and then you will respond in a clear voice, pronouncing each word precisely. Is that clear?"
tr_translation: “First rule,” said the father, “When Fury arrives, you will stand quietly in the hallway and wait to greet him. You will not speak until he speaks to you, and you will respond in a clear voice, using every word correctly. Understood?”
es_translation: —Rule number one —he said—. When the Fury arrives, you will stand in the foyer, in silence, and prepare to greet him. You will not say anything until he addresses you, and then you will respond in a clear voice, articulating your words well. Understood?

en: ‘And then one day things started to change,’ he continued. ‘I came home from school and my mother was making armbands for us from a special cloth and drawing a star on each one. Like this.’ Using his finger he drew a design in the dusty ground beneath him.

en: ‘He tells me about his family and the watch shop that he used to live over and the adventures he had coming here and the friends he used to have and the people he knows here and about the boys who he used to play with but he doesn’t any more because they disappeared without even saying goodbye to him.’

es: —Me habla de su familia y del piso que tenían encima de la relojería y de sus aventuras para venir aquí y de los amigos que tenía y de la gente que conoce aquí y de los niños con que jugaba pero con los que ya no juega porque desaparecieron sin despedirse de él.

en: ‘And yesterday he told me that his grandfather hasn’t been seen for days and no one knows where he is and whenever he asks his father about him he starts crying and hugs him so hard that he’s worried he’s going to squeeze him to death.’

tr: “Ve dün bana büyükbabasının günlerdir görünmediğini, nerede olduğunu kimsenin bilmediğini, ne zaman onu sorsa babasının ağlamaya başlayıp kendisine sanki öldürecekmiş gibi sımsıkı sarıldığını anlattı.
es: —Y ayer me contó que hace varios días que no ven a su abuelo y que nadie sabe dónde está y que cuando pregunta por él su padre se echa a llorar y lo abraza tan fuerte que le da miedo que lo espachurre.
