es_translation: —And yesterday he told me that they haven't seen his grandfather for several days and that nobody knows where he is, and that when he asks about him, his father starts crying and hugs him so tightly that he's afraid he might get squashed.

en: ‘No,’ she said, laughing. ‘I’m thirteen years old, for heaven’s sake! I can’t afford to act like a child even if you can.’
vi: “Không đâu,” cô nói, cười lớn. “Chị 13 tuổi rồi, vì Chúa! Chị không thể nào chịu nổi việc hành động như một đứa trẻ, dù em thì có thể.”
tr: Gretel, “Hayır,” diyerek güldü. “On üç yaşındayım, tanrı aşkına! Sen yapabiliyorsun diye ben de çocuk gibi davranamam.
es: —Es broma —dijo ella riendo—. ¡Por favor, pero si tengo trece años! No puedo comportarme como una cría.
vi_translation: “No way,” she said, laughing out loud. “I’m 13 years old, for God's sake! I can’t stand acting like a child, even if you can.”
tr_translation: Gretel laughed, saying "No." "I'm thirteen years old, for God's sake! Just because you can do it doesn't mean I have to act like a child."
es_translation: —It's a joke —she said, laughing—. Please, I'm only thirteen! I can't behave like a child.

en: ‘I’m very glad you’re here,’ he said, speaking with his mouth full. ‘If only you didn’t have to polish the glasses, I could show you my room.’
vi: “Tớ rất vui vì cậu ở đây,” cậu nói, nhồm nhoàm một mồm đầy. “Nếu cậu không phải đánh bóng ly thủy tinh, tớ có thể chỉ cho cậu phòng tớ.”
tr: “Burada olmana çok sevindim,” dedi dolu ağzıyla konuşarak. “Eğer bardakları parlatman gerekmeseydi sana odamı gösterebilirdim.
es: —Me alegro mucho de verte —dijo con la boca llena—. Es una lástima que tengas que limpiar los vasos. Si no, te enseñaría mi habitación.
vi_translation: "I'm really happy you're here," he said, his mouth full. "If you didn't have to polish the glass, I could show you my room."
tr_translation: “I'm so glad you're here,” he said, speaking with his mouth full. “If you didn't have to polish the glasses, I could show you my room.”
es_translation: —I'm very glad to see you —he said with his mouth full—. It's a shame that you have to clean the glasses. If not, I would show you my room.

en: ‘What happened to you?’ he asked and then didn’t wait for an answer. ‘Was it your bicycle? Because that happened to me back in Berlin a couple of years ago. I fell off when I was going too fast and was black and blue for weeks. Does it hurt?’
vi: “Chuyện gì đã xảy ra với cậu thế?” cậu hỏi nhưng không đợi câu trả lời. “Có phải tại xe đạp không? Vì mấy nắm trước hồi còn ở Berlin tớ cũng bị như thế. Tớ bị ngã khi đang đạp quá nhanh rồi bị thâm tím suốt mấy tuần liền. cậu có đau không?
tr: “Ne oldu sana?” diye sordu ve sonra cevabı beklemedi. “Bisikletinden mi düştün? Çünkü birkaç yıl önce Berlin’de benim de başıma gelmişti. Fazla hızlı giderken düşmüştüm ve haftalarca her tarafım yara bere ve çürük içindeydi. Acıyor mu?
es: —¿Qué te ha pasado? —preguntó, pero no esperó a que Shmuel contestara—. ¿Te has caído de la bicicleta? A mí me pasó una vez en Berlín, hace un par de años. Me caí porque iba demasiado rápido y estuve lleno de cardenales varias semanas. ¿Te duele?
vi_translation: “What happened to you?” he asked but didn't wait for an answer. “Is it because of the bicycle? Because a few years ago when I was in Berlin, the same thing happened to me. I fell while riding too fast and was bruised for weeks. Are you in pain?
tr_translation: “What happened to you?” he asked and then didn’t wait for an answer. “Did you fall off your bike? Because a few years ago in Berlin, the same thing happened to me. I fell while going too fast and for weeks I was covered in cuts and bruises. Does it hurt?”
es_translation: —What happened to you? —he asked, but didn't wait for Shmuel to answer—. Did you fall off your bike? It happened to me once in Berlin, a couple of years ago. I fell because I was going too fast and I was covered in bruises for several weeks. Does it hurt?

en: He enjoyed walking along the fence every afternoon and was pleased to see that his friend seemed a lot happier these days and his eyes didn’t seem so sunken, although his body was still ridiculously skinny and his face unpleasantly grey.
vi: Chiều chiều cậu khoan khoái bước dọc theo hàng rào rồi mừng rỡ khi thấy dạo này bạn mình vui lên nhiều và mắt nó có vẻ không còn quá trũng sâu, mặc dù cơ thể nó vẫn gầy gò đến kỳ lạ và gương mặt nó vẫn xám ngoét một cách đáng buồn.
tr: Her öğleden sonra tel örgüler boyunca yürümekten zevk alıyordu. Arkadaşının o günlerde çok daha mutlu gibi görünmesine ve gözlerinin eskisi kadar çukura kaçmış olmayışına seviniyordu, ama vücudu yine inanılmayacak derecede sıska, yüzü tatsız bir griydi.
es: Le encantaba echar a andar por la alambrada todas las tardes y se alegraba de ver que su amigo parecía mucho más contento últimamente y que ya no tenía los ojos tan hundidos, aunque seguía teniendo el cuerpo extremadamente delgado y la cara de una palidez muy desagradable.
vi_translation: In the afternoons, he leisurely walked along the fence and was delighted to see that his friend had become much happier lately and his eyes no longer seemed so deeply sunken, although his body was still strangely thin and his face remained sadly pale.
tr_translation: She enjoyed walking along the wire fences every afternoon. She was glad that her friend seemed much happier those days and that her eyes were no longer as sunken as before, but her body was still incredibly skinny, and her face was an unpleasant gray.
es_translation: He loved to walk along the fence every afternoon and was glad to see that his friend seemed much happier lately and that his eyes were no longer so sunken, although he still had an extremely thin body and a very unpleasantly pale face.

en: ‘Because every other boy I’ve ever been friends with has been someone that I’ve been able to play with,’ he replied. ‘And we never get to play together. All we get to do is sit here and talk.’
vi: “Bởi vì tất cả các cậu bạn khác tớ từng kết thân đều là người mà tớ có thể chơi cùng,” cậu trả lời. “Trong khi chúng ta chưa bao giờ chơi gì cùng nhau. Tất cả những gì chúng ta làm là ngồi đây nói chuyện.”
tr: “Çünkü şimdiye kadar arkadaş olduğum bütün çocuklarla oynayabildim,” diye cevap verdi. “Seninle hiç oynamıyoruz. Tek yapabildiğimiz burada oturup konuşmak.
es: —Porque con todos los otros niños que eran amigos míos podía jugar. Y nosotros nunca jugamos. Lo único que hacemos es sentarnos aquí y hablar.
vi_translation: “Because all the other friends I've ever made were people I could play with,” he replied. “Whereas we have never played anything together. All we do is sit here and talk.”
tr_translation: “Because I was able to play with all the children I have been friends with so far,” he replied. “We never play with you. All we can do is sit here and talk.”
es_translation: —Because with all the other children who were my friends, I could play. And we never play. The only thing we do is sit here and talk.

en: ‘I want to know about the fence,’ he said firmly, deciding that this was the most important thing to begin with. ‘I want to know why it’s there.’
vi: “em muốn biết về dãy hàng rào,” cậu kiên quyết nói, cho rằng đây là điều quan trọng nhất trước hết. “Em muốn biết tại sao nó lại ở đó.”
tr: “Tel örgüleri bilmek istiyorum,” dedi katı bir şekilde. Başlamak için bunun en önemli şey olduğuna karar vermişti. “Neden orada olduğunu öğrenmek isliyorum.
es: —Quiero saber qué es esa alambrada —dijo Bruno con firmeza, decidiendo que aquello era lo más importante, al menos para empezar—. Quiero saber por qué está ahí.
vi_translation: “I want to know about the fence,” he said firmly, believing that this was the most important thing first. “I want to know why it is there.”
tr_translation: “I want to know about the barbed wires,” he said sternly. He had decided that this was the most important thing to start with. “I want to learn why they are there.”
es_translation: —I want to know what that fence is —said Bruno firmly, deciding that this was the most important thing, at least to start with—. I want to know why it's there.

en: ‘It’s the filth around here that did it,’ said Mother. ‘If some people could only see the effect this place is having on us all.’
vi: “Chính rác rưởi quanh đây đã gây ra chuyện,” mẹ cậu nói. “Giá mà một số người có thể nhận thấy nơi này tác động tới tất cả chúng ta như thế nào.”
tr: “Buradaki pislik buna neden oldu,” dedi annesi. “Keşke bazı insanlar buranın bizi nasıl etkilediğini görebilse.
es: —Esto ha pasado por culpa de toda la porquería que hay aquí —se quejó Madre—. No entiendo cómo ciertas personas no se dan cuenta del efecto que este lugar está teniendo sobre nosotros.
vi_translation: “It’s the trash around here that caused this,” his mother said. “If only some people could see how this place affects all of us.”
tr_translation: “The filth here caused this,” said her mother. “I wish some people could see how this place affects us.”
es_translation: —This happened because of all the filth that's here —complained Mother—. I don't understand how certain people don't realize the effect this place is having on us.

en: ‘And what will people think,’ asked Father, ‘if I permit you and the children to return to Berlin without me? They will ask questions about my commitment to the work here.’
vi: “Thế rồi mọi người sẽ nghĩ sao,” cha cậu hỏi, “nếu anh cho phép em và các con trở về Berlin mà không có anh? Họ sẽ hỏi vô khối câu về sự tận tụy của anh đối với công việc ở đây.”
tr: “İnsanlar ne düşünecek,” diye sordu baba, “senin ve çocukların Berlin’e bensiz dönmenize izin verirsem? Buradaki işe bağlılığım hakkında sorular sorarlar.
es: —¿Y qué pensará la gente si permito que tú y los niños volváis a Berlín sin mí? —replicó Padre—. Harán preguntas sobre mi compromiso con el trabajo que desempeño aquí.
vi_translation: “Then what will everyone think,” his father asked, “if I allow you and the children to return to Berlin without me? They will ask countless questions about my dedication to the work here.”
tr_translation: “What will people think,” asked the father, “if I let you and the children return to Berlin without me? They will question my commitment to the job here.”
es_translation: —And what will people think if I allow you and the children to return to Berlin without me? —replied Father—. They will ask questions about my commitment to the work I do here.

en: ‘Friends,’ said Father, nodding his head. ‘Yes, I’ve often thought of that. It must have been lonely for you at times.’
vi: “Bạn be,” cha cậu nói, gật đầu. “Phải, cha vẫn thường nghĩ về chuyện đó. thỉnh thoảng chắc các con cô đơn lắm nhỉ.”
tr: “Arkadaşlar,” dedi baba, başını sallayarak. “Evet, bunu çok sık düşündüm. Bazı zamanlar yalnızlık çekmiş olmalısınız.
es: —Amigas —dijo Padre, asintiendo con la cabeza—. Sí, he pensado a menudo en eso. A veces debes de haberte sentido sola.
vi_translation: "My dear," his father said, nodding. "Yes, I often think about that. Sometimes you must feel very lonely."
tr_translation: “Friends,” said the father, shaking his head. “Yes, I have thought about this very often. At times, you must have felt lonely.”
es_translation: —Friends —said Father, nodding his head—. Yes, I have often thought about that. Sometimes you must have felt lonely.

en: ‘Well, for the moment I’m afraid that’s going to be impossible,’ said Father. ‘I’m afraid that the Fury will not relieve me of my command just yet. Mother, on the other hand, thinks this would be a good time for the three of you to return home and reopen the house, and when I think about it …’ He paused for a moment and looked out of the window to his left – the window that led off to a view of the camp on the other side of the fence. ‘When I think about it, perhaps she is right. Perhaps this is not a place for children.’
vi: “A, hiện thời cha e rằng điều đó là không thể,” cha cậu nói. “Cha e là Quốc trưởng sẽ chưa giảm gánh nặng vai trò chỉ huy cho cha ngay lúc này. Nhưng mặt khác, mẹ nghĩ đây là thời điểm hợp lý cho ba mẹ con trở về nhà và mở lại cửa ngôi nhà, và khi cha nghĩ kĩ...” ông dừng lại một lát và nhìn ra ngoài ô cửa sổ phía bên trái – khung cửa nhìn ra khu trại ở phía bên kia hàng rào. “Khi cha nghĩ kỹ, có lẽ mẹ các con đúng. Có lẽ đây không phải là nơi dành cho trẻ con.”
tr: “Korkarım şimdilik bu imkânsız,” dedi baba. “Fury şu an için beni görevimden almayacak. Öte yandan anneniz üçünüzün eski eve dönüp evi tekrar açmanızın zamanı olduğunu düşünüyor. Ve ben de düşününce...” Bir an durakladı ve solundaki pencereden dışarıya baktı, tel örgülerin diğer tarafındaki kampa bakan pencereye. “Ben de düşününce belki de haklıdır diyorum. Belki de burası çocuklara göre bir yer değil.
es: —Bien, me temo que de momento eso no será posible —dijo Padre—. Me temo que el Furias todavía no tiene previsto relevarme de mi puesto. Por otra parte, Madre cree que éste sería un buen momento para que vosotros tres volvierais a casa y os instalarais allí, y pensándolo bien... —Hizo una breve pausa y miró por la ventana que tenía a su izquierda, por la que se veía el campo que había al otro lado de la alambrada—. Pensándolo bien, quizá tenga razón. Quizá éste no sea un lugar adecuado para criar a dos niños.
vi_translation: “Ah, at the moment, I'm afraid that's not possible,” his father said. “I'm afraid the Head of State will not yet reduce the burden of command for me right now. But on the other hand, your mother thinks this is a reasonable time for the three of you to return home and reopen the house, and when I think it over...” he paused for a moment and looked out the window to the left – the window that looked out to the camp on the other side of the fence. “When I think it over, perhaps your mother is right. Perhaps this is not a place for children.”
tr_translation: “I'm afraid this is impossible for now,” said father. “Fury will not remove me from my duty at this moment. On the other hand, your mother thinks it's time for the three of you to go back to the old house and reopen it. And when I think about it...” He paused for a moment and looked out the window to his left, the window overlooking the camp on the other side of the barbed wire. “When I think about it, I say maybe she is right. Maybe this place is not suitable for children.”
es_translation: "Well, I'm afraid that won't be possible for the moment," said Father. "I'm afraid the Fury hasn't planned to relieve me of my post yet." "On the other hand, Mother thinks this would be a good time for you three to go back home and settle there, and thinking about it... —He paused briefly and looked out the window to his left, through which the field on the other side of the fence could be seen—. "Thinking about it, maybe she's right." "Maybe this isn't a suitable place to raise two children."

en: ‘I imagine the men were taken to work in another town and they have to stay there for a few days until the work is done. And the post isn’t very good here anyway. I expect he’ll turn up one day soon.’
vi: “Tớ hình dung là những người đó đã được đưa đi làm việc ở một thành phố khác và họ phải ở lại đó vài ngày cho đến khi công việc hoàn thành. Mà bưu điện ở đó lại không được tốt lắm. Tớ đoán là cha cậu sẽ trở về một ngày gần đây thôi.”
tr: “Sanırım işçiler başka bir şehre götürüldüler ve iş bitene kadar birkaç gün orada kalmaları gerekiyor. Ve posta zaten pek iyi değil. Eminim yakında çıkıp gelir.
es: —Supongo que habrán llevado a los hombres a trabajar a otro pueblo y que tendrán que quedarse allí unos días, hasta que terminen su trabajo. De todas formas, este sitio no es ninguna maravilla. Ya verás como no tarda en aparecer.
vi_translation: “I imagine that those people were taken to work in another city and they have to stay there for a few days until the work is done. But the post office there is not very good. I guess your father will come back one day soon.”
tr_translation: “I think the workers were taken to another city and they need to stay there for a few days until the work is done. And the mail is already not very good. I'm sure it will come out soon.”
es_translation: —I suppose they have taken the men to work in another town and that they will have to stay there for a few days, until they finish their work. Anyway, this place is no wonder. You will see that it won't take long for him to appear.

en: ‘We’ve been talking to each other for more than a year and we never got to play once. And do you know what else?’ he added. ‘All this time I’ve been watching where you live from out of my bedroom window and I’ve never even seen for myself what it’s like.’
vi: “Bọn mình đã nói chuyện với nhau hơn một năm rồi nhưng bọn mình chưa bao giờ được chơi cùng nhau cả. Và cậu có biết gì nữa không?” Bruno nói thêm. “Suốt thời gian đó tớ đã ngắm nhìn nơi cậu sống từ cửa sổ phòng ngủ của tớ mà lại chưa bao giờ được tận mắt nhìn thấy nói đó như thế nào.”
tr: “Bir yıldan fazla zamandır birbirimizle konuşuyoruz ve bir kez bile oynayamadık. Ve bir de ne, biliyor musun?” diye ekledi. “Bunca zamandır yaşadığın yeri, odamın penceresinden izliyorum; ancak daha neye benzediğini görmüş değilim.
es: —Llevamos más de un año hablando y no hemos podido jugar ni una sola vez. ¿Y sabes otra cosa? —agregó—. Todo este tiempo he estado observando dónde vives desde la ventana de mi dormitorio, pero nunca he visto por mí mismo cómo es.
vi_translation: "We've been talking to each other for over a year now, but we've never had the chance to play together." "And do you know what else?" Bruno added. "All that time, I had been looking at the place where you live from my bedroom window, but I had never actually seen what it was like."
tr_translation: “We have been talking to each other for more than a year, and we haven't played even once. And guess what, you know?” he added. “All this time, I've been watching where you live from my room's window, but I still haven't seen what it looks like.”
es_translation: —We have been talking for over a year and we haven't been able to play even once. And you know what else? —he added—. All this time I have been observing where you live from my bedroom window, but I have never seen for myself what it is like.

en: However, the clock was ticking and there was nothing he could do about it. And after all, it was only the morning and a lot could happen between then and the late afternoon, which was when the two boys always met. The rain would surely have stopped by then.
vi: Tuy nhiên, đồng hồ vẫn tích tắc mà cậu chẳng thể làm gì ngăn lại. Nhưng xét cho cùng, giờ chỉ mới là buổi sáng và từ giờ tới chiều muộn lúc hai cậu bé gặp nhau vẫn còn nhiều điều có thể xảy ra. Chắc hẳn là khi ấy thì mưa đã tạnh.
tr: Ama zaman geçiyordu ve bu konuda yapabileceği bir şey yoktu. Ayrıca daha sabahtı ve şu an ile geç saatler -çocukların hep buluştuğu öğleden sonra- arasında çok şey olabilirdi. Yağmur o zamana kadar elbette dururdu.
es: Sin embargo, las agujas del reloj seguían avanzando y él no podía remediarlo. Además, todavía era temprano y podían pasar muchas cosas desde aquel momento hasta última hora de la tarde, que era cuando solían encontrarse los dos amigos. Seguramente para entonces habría parado de llover.
vi_translation: However, the clock kept ticking and he couldn't do anything to stop it. But all things considered, it was still morning and there were many things that could happen from now until late afternoon when the two boys would meet. Surely by then, the rain would have stopped.
tr_translation: But time was passing, and there was nothing he could do about it. Moreover, it was still morning, and a lot could happen between now and the late hours - the afternoon when the children always met. Of course, the rain would have stopped by then.
es_translation: However, the hands of the clock kept moving forward and he couldn't do anything about it. Moreover, it was still early and many things could happen from that moment until late in the afternoon, which was when the two friends usually met. Surely by then it would have stopped raining.

en: His boots squelched in the mud and he started to enjoy the walk more than he ever had before. With every step he seemed to face the danger of toppling over and falling down, but he never did and managed to keep his balance, even at a particularly bad part where, when he lifted his left leg, his boot stayed implanted in the mud while his foot slipped right out of it.
vi: Ủng của cậu ì ọp lọi trong bùn và cậu bắt đầu cảm thấy thích chuyến đi này hơn bao giờ hết. Mỗi bước đi cậu dường như đều phải đối mặt với khả năng bị trượt chân ngã nhưng cậu chẳng hề bị ngã và xoay xở giữ được thăng bằng, ngay cả ở một chỗ đặc biệt tệ hại nơi, khi cậu nhấc chân trai lên, chiếc ủng vẫn dính chặt trong bùn còn chân cậu thì tuột hẳn ra khỏi ủng.
tr: Bollan çamurda ses çıkartıyordu ve yürüyüşü her zamankinden fazla sevmeye başlamıştı. Her adımda takılıp düşme tehlikesiyle karşı karşıyaydı. Hiç düşmedi ve dengesini koruyabildi. Ayağını kaldırdığında botunun çamura saplanıp kaldığı ve ayağının çıktığı zor bir bölümde bile...
es: Sus botas chapoteaban por el barro y Bruno disfrutó más que nunca con el trayecto. A cada paso que daba se arriesgaba a tropezar y caerse, pero eso no llegó a suceder y consiguió mantener el equilibrio, incluso en un tramo del camino particularmente difícil, cuando levantó la pierna izquierda, la bota quedó enganchada en el barro y el pie se le salió.
vi_translation: Your boots squelched in the mud, and you began to enjoy the trip more than ever. With each step, you seemed to face the possibility of slipping and falling, but you never did and managed to keep your balance, even at a particularly bad spot where, when you lifted your left foot, the boot stuck firmly in the mud while your foot slipped completely out of the boot.
tr_translation: The ball was making noise in the mud and he had started to enjoy the walk more than ever. With every step, he was at risk of tripping and falling. He never fell and was able to maintain his balance. Even in a difficult section where his boot got stuck in the mud and his foot came out when he lifted it...
es_translation: His boots splashed through the mud, and Bruno enjoyed the journey more than ever. With each step he took, he risked tripping and falling, but that never happened, and he managed to keep his balance, even on a particularly difficult stretch of the path, when he lifted his left leg, the boot got stuck in the mud, and his foot came out.

en: He had thought that there would be a shop in the centre, and maybe a small café like the ones he had known in Berlin; he had wondered whether there would be a fruit and vegetable stall.
vi: Cậu đã nghĩ có một cửa hiệu ở trung tâm khu trại, và có thể cả một quán café nhỏ giống những quán cậu từng ở Berlin; cậu băn khoăn tự hỏi liệu ở đây có tiệm rau quả nào không.
tr: Ortada bir dükkân olacağını düşünmüştü ve belki Berlin’de gördükleri gibi küçük bir kafe. Acaba meyve ve sebze tezgâhı var mıdır diye merak etmişti.
es: Había imaginado que habría una tienda en el centro y quizá una pequeña cafetería como las de Berlín; y se había preguntado si habría un puesto de fruta y verdura.
vi_translation: You thought there was a shop in the center of the camp, and possibly a small café like the ones you had been to in Berlin; you wondered if there was a vegetable store here.
tr_translation: He thought there would be a shop in the middle and maybe a small café like the ones he had seen in Berlin. He wondered if there was a fruit and vegetable stall.
es_translation: I had imagined that there would be a store in the center and perhaps a small café like those in Berlin; and I had wondered if there would be a fruit and vegetable stand.

en: In another corner he could see more soldiers standing around and laughing and looking down the barrels of their guns, aiming them in random directions, but not firing them.
vi: Ở một góc khác, cậu thấy nhiều lính hơn đứng quanh, vừa cười lớn vừa nhìn xuống nòng súng, chĩa về hướng bất kỳ nhưng không siết cò.
tr: Başka bir köşede ayakta durup gülen askerler gördü, silahlarının namlusunu farklı yönlere çevirip nişan alıyor, ama ateş etmiyorlardı.
es: En otra esquina había más soldados, riendo y manipulando sus fusiles, apuntando hacia un lado y otro pero sin disparar.
vi_translation: In another corner, he saw more soldiers standing around, laughing loudly while looking down the barrels of their guns, pointing them in any direction but not pulling the trigger.
tr_translation: He saw soldiers standing and laughing in another corner, pointing the barrels of their guns in different directions, but not firing.
es_translation: In another corner, there were more soldiers, laughing and handling their rifles, pointing them this way and that but not firing.

en: In fact everywhere he looked, all he could see was two different types of people: either happy, laughing, shouting soldiers in their uniforms or unhappy, crying people in their striped pyjamas, most of whom seemed to be staring into space as if they were actually asleep.
vi: Sự thực thì nhìn đâu cậu cũng chỉ thấy có hai loại người khác nhau: hoặc những người lính mặc đồng phục đang sung sướng, cười ha hả, la hét, hoặc những người đang mặc đồ pyjama sọc đang buồn bã, khóc lóc, hầu hết đều dường như nhìn chằm chằm vào khoảng không như thể kỳ thực họ đang ngủ.
tr: Aslında baktığı her yerde iki farklı tip insan görebiliyordu: Mutlu, gülen, bağıran üniformalı askerler ve çizgili pijamaları içinde mutsuz, ağlayan, birçoğu sanki uyuyormuş gibi boşluğa bakan insanlar...
es: De hecho, allá donde mirase, lo único que veía era dos clases de personas: alegres soldados uniformados que reían y gritaban, y personas cabizbajas con su pijama de rayas, la mayoría con la mirada perdida, como si se hubieran dormido con los ojos abiertos.
vi_translation: In reality, wherever you look, you only see two different types of people: either soldiers in uniform who are happy, laughing loudly, shouting, or people in striped pajamas who are sad, crying, most of whom seem to be staring into space as if they are actually asleep.
tr_translation: Actually, wherever he looked, he could see two different types of people: Happy, smiling, shouting uniformed soldiers and unhappy, crying people in striped pajamas, many of whom stared into space as if they were asleep...
es_translation: In fact, wherever he looked, the only thing he saw were two kinds of people: cheerful uniformed soldiers who laughed and shouted, and downcast people in striped pajamas, most of them with a lost look, as if they had fallen asleep with their eyes open.

en: But just as he said this, his feet brought him up a set of steps, and as he marched on he found there was no more rain coming down any more because they were all piling into a long room that was surprisingly warm and must have been very securely built because no rain was getting in anywhere. In fact it felt completely airtight.
vi: Nhưng ngay sau khi cậu nói vậy, đôi chân đã đưa cậu bước lên một bậc tam cấp và khi bước tiếp cậu nhận ra rằng không còn mưa rơi xuống nữa. Tất cả bọn họ đã bị nhét vào một căn phòng dài ấm áp đến kinh ngạc và hẳn được xây hết sức an toàn vì chẳng có giọt mưa nào lọt được vào bất cứ đâu. Đúng ra thì nó hoàn toàn kín mít.
tr: Ama lam bunu söylediğinde ayakları onu merdivenlere getirdi ve yağmurun kesildiğini gördü. Şaşırtıcı derecede sıcak, uzun bir odaya yığılıyorlardı ve iyi şekilde inşa edilmiş olmalıydı; çünkü içeriye yağmur sızmıyordu. Aslında tamamen hava geçirmez gibiydi.
es: Pero apenas lo dijo, sus pies subieron unos escalones y, sin detenerse, comprobó que ya no se mojaba porque estaban todos amontonados en un recinto largo y sorprendentemente cálido. Debía de estar muy bien construido porque allí no entraba ni una sola gota de lluvia. De hecho, parecía completamente hermético.
vi_translation: But right after he said that, his legs carried him up a step, and as he continued walking, he realized that no more rain was falling. They had all been stuffed into a long room that was surprisingly warm and must have been built very securely because not a single drop of rain could get in anywhere. In fact, it was completely sealed.
tr_translation: But when she said this, her feet carried her to the stairs, and she saw that the rain had stopped. They were piling into a surprisingly warm, long room, and it must have been well-built; because no rain was leaking inside. In fact, it seemed completely airtight.
es_translation: But as soon as he said it, his feet climbed a few steps and, without stopping, he realized that he was no longer getting wet because they were all crowded into a long and surprisingly warm enclosure. It must have been very well constructed because not a single drop of rain entered there. In fact, it seemed completely airtight.

en: ‘Well, that’s something,’ he said, glad to be out of the storm for a few minutes at least. ‘I expect we’ll have to wait here till it eases off and then I’ll get to go home.’
vi: “Ồ, phải thế chứ,” cậu nói, vui sướng được thoát khỏi cơn bão ít nhất là trong vài phút. “Tớ hy vọng chúng ta sẽ được chờ ở đây cho tới khi tạnh hẳn và rồi sau đó tớ sẽ về nhà.
tr: “Vay canına, bu iyi!” dedi. En azından birkaç dakikalığına fırtınadan uzaklaşmış olmaktan mutluydu. “Sanırım yağmur dinene kadar burada kalırız ve sonra eve gidebilirim.
es: —Bueno, menos mal —comentó, alegrándose de haberse librado de la tormenta aunque sólo fuera por unos minutos—. Supongo que esperaremos aquí hasta que amaine y que luego podré marcharme a casa.
vi_translation: “Oh, that's better,” he said, delighted to be out of the storm for at least a few minutes. “I hope we can wait here until it completely stops, and then I'll go home.”
tr_translation: “Wow, this is good!” he said. At least for a few minutes, he was happy to be away from the storm. “I guess we'll stay here until the rain stops, and then I can go home.”
es_translation: —Well, thank goodness —he commented, glad to have escaped the storm even if only for a few minutes—. I suppose we'll wait here until it calms down and then I can go home.

en: A few months after that some other soldiers came to Out-With and Father was ordered to go with them, and he went without complaint and he was happy to do so because he didn’t really mind what they did to him any more.
vi: Vài tháng sau đó một vài người lính khác đến Ao Tuýt và cha Bruno bị yêu cầu đi cùng với họ, và ông đã đi mà chẳng than phiền gì và ông hạnh phúc khi làm vậy bởi vì ông chẳng còn thiết quan tâm tới chuyện họ làm gì với ông nữa.
tr: Bundan birkaç ay sonra Out-With’e başka askerler geldi ve babaya, onlarla gitmesi emredildi. Hiç karşı çıkmadan gitti ve bunu yaptığı için mutluydu; çünkü ona ne olacağı arlık umurunda değildi...
es: Unos meses más tarde, llegaron otros soldados a Auchviz y ordenaron a Padre que los acompañara, y él fue sin protestar y se alegró de hacerlo porque ya no le importaba lo que le hicieran.
vi_translation: A few months later, some other soldiers came to Ao Tuýt and Father Bruno was asked to go with them, and he went without complaint and he was happy to do so because he no longer cared about what they did to him.
tr_translation: A few months later, other soldiers came to Out-With and ordered the father to go with them. He went without any resistance and was happy to do so; because he no longer cared about what would happen to him...
es_translation: A few months later, other soldiers arrived at Auchviz and ordered Father to accompany them, and he went without protesting and was glad to do so because he no longer cared what they did to him.
